wisdom can devise such subject of political agitation as occupy the public mind consist to a great extent of exaggeration of inevitable evil or over zeal in social improvement or mere imagination of grievance have but remote connection with any of the constitutional function or duty of the federal government to whatever extent these question exhibit a tendency menacing to the stability of the constitution or the integrity of the union and no far they demand the consideration of the executive and require to be present by he to congress before the thirteen colony become a confederation of independent states they be associate only by community of transatlantic origin by geographical position and by the mutual tie of common dependence on great britain when that tie be sunder they severally assume the power and right of absolute self government the municipal and social institution of each its law of property and of personal relation even its political organization be such only as each one choose to establish wholly without interference from any other in the language of the declaration of independence each state have full power to levy war conclude peace contract alliance establish commerce and to do all other act and thing which independent state may of right do the several colony differ in climate in soil in natural production in religion in system of education in legislation and in the form of political administration and they continue to differ in these respect when they voluntarily ally themselves as states to carry on the war of the revolution the object of that war be to disenthrall the united colony from foreign rule which have prove to be oppressive and to separate they permanently from the mother country the political result be the foundation of a federal republic of the free white man of the colony constitute as they be in distinct and reciprocally independent state government as for the subject race whether indian or african the wise and brave statesman of that day be engage in no extravagant scheme of social change leave they as they be and thus preserve themselves and their posterity from the anarchy and the ever recur civil war which have prevail in other revolutionize european colony of america when the confederate state find it convenient to modify the condition of their association by give to the general government direct access in some respect to the people of the states instead of confine it to action on the states as such they proceed to frame the exist constitution adhere steadily to one guide thought which be to delegate only such power as be necessary and proper to the execution of specific purpose or in other word to retain as much as possible consistently with those purpose of the independent power of the individual state for object of common defense and security they intrust to the general government certain carefully define function leave all other as the undelegated right of the separate independent sovereignty such be the constitutional theory of our government the practical observance of which have carry we and we alone among modern republic through nearly three generation of time without the cost of one drop of blood shed in civil war with freedom and concert of action it have enable we to contend successfully on the battlefield against foreign foe have elevate the feeble colony into powerful states and have raise our industrial production and our commerce which transport they to the level of the rich and the great nation of europe and the admirable adaptation of our political institution to their object combine local self government with aggregate strength have establish the practicability of a government like our to cover a continent with confederate state the congress of the united states be in effect that congress of sovereignty which good man in the old world have seek for but could never attain and which impart to america an exemption from the mutable league for common action from the war the mutual invasion and vague aspiration after the balance of power which convulse from time to time the government of europe our cooperative action rest in the condition of permanent confederation prescribe by the constitution our balance of power be in the separate reserve right of the states and their equal representation in the senate that independent sovereignty in every one of the states with its reserved right of local self government assure to each by their coequal power in the senate be the fundamental condition of the constitution without it the union would never have exist however desirous the large state might be to reorganize the government so as to give to their population its proportionate weight in the common counsel they know it be impossible unless they concede to the small one authority to exercise at least a negative influence on all the measure of the government whether legislative or executive through their equal representation in the senate indeed the large states themselves could not have fail to perceive that the same power be equally necessary to they for the security of their own domestic interest against the aggregate force of the general government in a word the original states go into this permanent league on the agree premise of exert their common strength for the defense of the whole and of all its part but of utterly exclude all capability of reciprocal aggression each solemnly bind itself to all the other neither to undertake nor permit any encroachment upon or intermeddle with another 's reserve right where it be deem expedient particular right of the states be expressly guarantee by the constitution but in all thing besides these right be guard by the limitation of the power grant and by express reservation of all power not grant in the compact of union thus the great power of taxation be limit to purpose of common defense and general welfare exclude object appertain to the local legislation of the several states and those purpose of general welfare and common defense be afterwards define by specific enumeration as be matter only of co relation between the states themselves or between they and foreign government which because of their common and general nature could not be leave to the separate control of each state of the circumstance of local condition interest and right in which a portion of the states constitute one great section of the union differ from the rest and from another section the most important be the peculiarity of a large relative colored population in the southern than in the northern states a population of this class hold in subjection exist in nearly all the states but be more numerous and of more serious concernment in the south than in the north on account of natural difference of climate and production and it be foresee that for the same reason while this population would diminish and soon or later cease to exist in some states it might increase in other the peculiar character and magnitude of this question of local right not in material relation only but still more in social one cause it to enter into the special stipulation of the constitution hence while the general government as well by the enumerate power grant to it as by those not enumerate and therefore refuse to it be forbid to touch this matter in the sense of attack or offense it be place under the general safeguard of the union in the sense of defense against either invasion or domestic violence like all other local interest of the several states each state expressly stipulate as well for itself as for each and all of its citizen and every citizen of each state became solemnly bind by his allegiance to the constitution that any person hold to service or labor in one state escape into another should not in consequence of any law or regulation thereof be discharge from such service or labor but should be deliver up on claim of the party to whom such service or labor might be due by the law of his state thus and thus only by the reciprocal guaranty of all the right of every state against interference on the part of another be the present form of government establish by our father and transmit to we and by no other mean be it possible for it to exist if one state cease to respect the right of another and obtrusively intermeddle with its local interest if a portion of the states assume to impose their institution on the other or refuse to fulfill their obligation to they we be no long united friendly states but distracted hostile one with little capacity leave of common advantage but abundant mean of reciprocal injury and mischief practically it be immaterial whether aggressive interference between the states or deliberate refusal on the part of any one of they to comply with constitutional obligation arise from erroneous conviction or blind prejudice whether it be perpetrate by direction or indirection in either case it be full of threat and of danger to the durability of the union place in the office of chief magistrate as the executive agent of the whole country bind to take care that the law be faithfully execute and specially enjoin by the constitution to give information to congress on the state of the union it would be palpable neglect of duty on my part to pass over a subject like this which beyond all thing at the present time vitally concern individual and public security it have be matter of painful regret to see states conspicuous for their service in round this republic and equally share its advantage disregard their constitutional obligation to it although conscious of their inability to heal admit and palpable social evil of their own and which be completely within their jurisdiction they engage in the offensive and hopeless undertaking of reform the domestic institution of other states wholly beyond their control and authority in the vain pursuit of end by they entirely unattainable and which they may not legally attempt to compass they peril the very existence of the constitution and all the countless benefit which it have confer while the people of the southern states confine their attention to their own affair not presume officiously to intermeddle with the social institution of the northern states too many of the inhabitant of the latter be permanently organize in association to inflict injury on the former by wrongful act which would be cause of war as between foreign power and only fail to be such in our system because perpetrate under cover of the union be it possible to present this subject as truth and the occasion require without notice the reiterated but groundless allegation that the south have persistently assert claim and obtain advantage in the practical administration of the general government to the prejudice of the north and in which the latter have acquiesce that is the state which either promote or tolerate attack on the right of person and of property in other states to disguise their own injustice pretend or imagine and constantly aver that they whose constitutional right be thus systematically assail be themselves the aggressor at the present time this imputed aggression rest as it do only in the vague declamatory charge of political agitator resolve itself into misapprehension or misinterpretation of the principle and fact of the political organization of the new territories of the united states what be the voice of history when the ordinance which provide for the government of the territory northwest of the river ohio and for its eventual subdivision into new states be adopt in the congress of the confederation it be not to be suppose that the question of future relative power as between the states which retain and those which do not retain a numerous colored population escape notice or fail to be consider and yet the concession of that vast territory to the interest and opinion of the northern states a territory now the seat of five among the large member of the union be in great measure the act of the state of virginia and of the south when louisiana be acquire by the united states it be an acquisition not less to the north than to the south for while it be important to the country at the mouth of the river mississippi to become the emporium of the country above it so also it be even more important to the whole union to have that emporium and although the new province by reason of its imperfect settlement be mainly regard as on the gulf of mexico yet in fact it extend to the opposite boundary of the united states with far great breadth above than below and be in territory as in everything else equally at least an accession to the northern states it be mere delusion and prejudice therefore to speak of louisiana as acquisition in the special interest of the south the patriotic and just man who participate in the act be influence by motive far above all sectional jealousy it be in truth the great event which by complete for we the possession of the valley of the mississippi with commercial access to the gulf of mexico imparted unity and strength to the whole confederation and attach together by indissoluble tie the east and the west as well as the north and the south as to florida that be but the transfer by spain to the united states of territory on the east side of the river mississippi in exchange for large territory which the united states transfer to spain on the west side of that river as the entire diplomatic history of the transaction serve to demonstrate moreover it be an acquisition demand by the commercial interest and the security of the whole union in the meantime the people of the united states have grow up to a proper consciousness of their strength and in a brief contest with france and in a second serious war with great britain they have shake off all which remain of undue reverence for europe and emerge from the atmosphere of those transatlantic influence which surround the infant republic and have begin to turn their attention to the full and systematic development of the internal resource of the union among the evanescent controversy of that period the most conspicuous be the question of regulation by congress of the social condition of the future states to be round in the territory of louisiana the ordinance for the government of the territory northwest of the river ohio have contain a provision which prohibit the use of servile labor therein subject to the condition of the extradition of fugitive from service due in any other part of the united states subsequently to the adoption of the constitution this provision cease to remain as a law for its operation as such be absolutely supersede by the constitution but the recollection of the fact excite the zeal of social propagandism in some section of the confederation and when a second state that of missouri come to be form in the territory of louisiana proposition be make to extend to the latter territory the restriction originally apply to the country situate between the river ohio and mississippi most questionable as be this proposition in all its constitutional relation nevertheless it receive the sanction of congress with some slight modification of line to save the exist right of the intended new state it be reluctantly acquiesce in by southern states as a sacrifice to the cause of peace and of the union not only of the right stipulate by the treaty of louisiana but of the principle of equality among the states guarantee by the constitution it be receive by the northern states with angry and resentful condemnation and complaint because it do not concede all which they have exactingly demand having pass through the form of legislation it take its place in the statute book stand open to repeal like any other act of doubtful constitutionality subject to be pronounce null and void by the court of law and possess no possible efficacy to control the right of the states which might thereafter be organize out of any part of the original territory of louisiana in all this if any aggression there be any innovation upon preexist right to which portion of the union be they justly chargeable this controversy pass away with the occasion nothing survive it save the dormant letter of the statute but long afterwards when by the propose accession of the republic of texas the united states be to take their next step in territorial greatness a similar contingency occur and become the occasion for systematize attempt to intervene in the domestic affair of one section of the union in defiance of their right as states and of the stipulation of the constitution these attempt assume a practical direction in the shape of persevere endeavor by some of the representatives in both houses of congress to deprive the southern states of the suppose benefit of the provision of the act authorize the organization of the state of missouri but the good sense of the people and the vital force of the constitution triumph over sectional prejudice and the political error of the day and the state of texas return to the union as she be with social institution which her people have choose for themselves and with express agreement by the reannexing act that she should be susceptible of subdivision into a plurality of states whatever advantage the interest of the southern states as such gain by this be far inferior in result as they unfold in the progress of time to those which spring from previous concession make by the south to every thoughtful friend of the union to the true lover of their country to all who long and labor for the full success of this great experiment of republican institution it be cause of gratulation that such an opportunity have occur to illustrate our advance power on this continent and to furnish to the world additional assurance of the strength and stability of the constitution who would wish to see florida still a european colony who would rejoice to hail texas as a lone star instead of one in the galaxy of states who do not appreciate the incalculable benefit of the acquisition of louisiana and yet narrow view and sectional purpose would inevitably have exclude they all from the union but another struggle on the same point ensue when our victorious army return from mexico and it devolve on congress to provide for the territory acquire by the treaty of guadalupe hidalgo the great relation of the subject have now become distinct and clear to the perception of the public mind which appreciate the evil of sectional controversy upon the question of the admission of new states in that crisis intense solicitude pervade the nation but the patriotic impulse of the popular heart guide by the admonitory advice of the father of his country rise superior to all the difficulty of the incorporation of a new empire into the union in the counsel of congress there be manifest extreme antagonism of opinion and action between some representatives who seek by the abusive and unconstitutional employment of the legislative power of the government to interfere in the condition of the inchoate states and to impose their own social theory upon the latter and other representatives who repel the interposition of the general government in this respect and maintain the self constitute right of the states in truth the thing attempt be in form alone action of the general government while in reality it be the endeavor by abuse of legislative power to force the idea of internal policy entertain in particular states upon ally independent states once more the constitution and the union triumph signally the new territory be organize without restriction on the dispute point and be thus leave to judge in that particular for themselves and the sense of constitutional faith prove vigorous enough in congress not only to accomplish this primary object but also the incidental and hardly less important one of so amend the provision of the statute for the extradition of fugitive from service as to place that public duty under the safeguard of the general government and thus relieve it from obstacle raise up by the legislation of some of the states vain declamation regard the provision of law for the extradition of fugitive from service with occasional episode of frantic effort to obstruct their execution by riot and murder continue for a brief time to agitate certain locality but the true principle of leave each state and territory to regulate its own law of labor accord to its own sense of right and expediency have acquire fast hold of the public judgment to such a degree that by common consent it be observe in the organization of the territory of washington when more recently it become requisite to organize the territories of nebraska and kansas it be the natural and legitimate if not the inevitable consequence of previous event and legislation that the same great and sound principle which have already be apply to utah and new mexico should be apply to they that they should stand exempt from the restriction propose in the act relative to the state of missouri these restriction be in the estimation of many thoughtful man null from the beginning unauthorized by the constitution contrary to the treaty stipulation for the cession of louisiana and inconsistent with the equality of these states they have be strip of all moral authority by persistent effort to procure their indirect repeal through contradictory enactment they have be practically abrogate by the legislation attend the organization of utah new mexico and washington if any vitality remain in they it would have be take away in effect by the new territorial act in the form originally propose to the senate at the first session of the last congress it be manly and ingenuous as well as patriotic and just to do this directly and plainly and thus relieve the statute book of an act which might be of possible future injury but of no possible future benefit and the measure of its repeal be the final consummation and complete recognition of the principle that no portion of the united states shall undertake through assumption of the power of the general government to dictate the social institution of any other portion the scope and effect of the language of repeal be not leave in doubt it be declare in term to be the true intent and meaning of this act not to legislate slavery into any territory or state nor to exclude it therefrom but to leave the people thereof perfectly free to form and regulate their domestic institution in their own way subject only to the constitution of the united states "the measure could not be withstand upon its merit alone it be attack with violence on the false or delusive pretext that it constitute a breach of faith never be objection more utterly destitute of substantial justification when before be it imagine by sensible man that a regulative or declarative statute whether enact ten or forty year ago be irrepealable that an act of congress be above the constitution if indeed there be in the fact any cause to impute bad faith it would attach to those only who have never cease from the time of the enactment of the restrictive provision to the present day to denounce and condemn it who have constantly refuse to complete it by needful supplementary legislation who have spare no exertion to deprive it of moral force who have themselves again and again attempt its repeal by the enactment of incompatible provision and who by the inevitable reactionary effect of their own violence on the subject awaken the country to perception of the true constitutional principle of leave the matter involve to the discretion of the people of the respective exist or incipient state it be not pretend that this principle or any other preclude the possibility of evil in practice disturb as political action be liable to be by human passion no form of government be exempt from inconvenience but in this case they be the result of the abuse and not of the legitimate exercise of the power reserve or confer in the organization of a territory they be not to be charge to the great principle of popular sovereignty on the contrary they disappear before the intelligence and patriotism of the people exert through the ballot box their peaceful and silent but irresistible power if the friend of the constitution be to have another struggle its enemy could not present a more acceptable issue than that of a state whose constitution clearly embrace a republican form of government be exclude from the union because its domestic institution may not in all respect comport with the idea of what be wise and expedient entertain in some other state fresh from groundless imputation of breach of faith against other man will commence the agitation of this new question with indubitable violation of an express compact between the independent sovereign power of the united states and of the republic of texas as well as of the old and equally solemn compact which assure the equality of all the states but deplorable as would be such a violation of compact in itself and in all its direct consequence that be the very least of the evil involve when sectional agitator shall have succeed in force on this issue can their pretension fail to be meet by counter pretension will not different state be compel respectively to meet extreme with extreme and if either extreme carry its point what be that so far forth but dissolution of the union if a new state form from the territory of the united states be absolutely exclude from admission therein that fact of itself constitute the disruption of union between it and the other states but the process of dissolution could not stop there would not a sectional decision produce such result by a majority of vote either northern or southern of necessity drive out the oppressed and aggrieved minority and place in presence of each other two irreconcilably hostile confederations?it be necessary to speak thus plainly of project the offspring of that sectional agitation now prevail in some of the states which be as impracticable as they be unconstitutional and which if persevere in must and will end calamitously it be either disunion and civil war or it be mere angry idle aimless disturbance of public peace and tranquillity disunion for what if the passionate rage of fanaticism and partisan spirit do not force the fact upon our attention it would be difficult to believe that any considerable portion of the people of this enlightened country could have so surrender themselves to a fanatical devotion to the suppose interest of the relatively few africans in the united states as totally to abandon and disregard the interest of the 25,000,000 americans to trample under foot the injunction of moral and constitutional obligation and to engage in plan of vindictive hostility against those who be associate with they in the enjoyment of the common heritage of our national institution nor be it hostility against their fellow citizen of one section of the union alone the interest the honor the duty the peace and the prosperity of the people of all section be equally involved and imperil in this question and be patriotic man in any part of the union prepare on such issue thus madly to invite all the consequence of the forfeiture of their constitutional engagement it be impossible the storm of frenzy and faction must inevitably dash itself in vain against the unshaken rock of the constitution i shall never doubt it i know that the union be strong a thousand time than all the wild and chimerical scheme of social change which be generate one after another in the unstable mind of visionary sophist and interested agitator i rely confidently on the patriotism of the people on the dignity and self respect of the states on the wisdom of congress and above all on the continue gracious favor of almighty god to maintain against all enemy whether at home or abroad the sanctity of the constitution and the integrity of the union
circumstance have occur to disturb the course of governmental organization in the territory of kansas and produce there a condition of thing which render it incumbent on i to call your attention to the subject and urgently to recommend the adoption by you of such measure of legislation as the grave exigency of the case appear to require
 a brief exposition of the circumstance refer to and of their cause will be necessary to the full understanding of the recommendation which it be propose to submit
 the act to organize the territories of nebraska and kansas be a manifestation of the legislative opinion of congress on two great point of constitutional construction one that the designation of the boundary of a new territory and provision for its political organization and administration as a territory be measure which of right fall within the power of the general government and the other that the inhabitant of any such territory consider as an inchoate state be entitle in the exercise of self government to determine for themselves what shall be their own domestic institution subject only to the constitution and the law duly enact by congress under it and to the power of the exist state to decide accord to the provision and principle of the constitution at what time the territory shall be receive as a state into the union such be the great political right which be solemnly declare and affirm by that act
 base upon this theory the act of congress define for each territory the outline of republican government distribute public authority among lawfully create agent executive judicial and legislative to be appoint either by the general government or by the territory the legislative function be intrust to a council and a house of representative duly elect and empower to enact all the local law which they might deem essential to their prosperity happiness and good government act in the same spirit congress also define the person who be in the first instance to be consider as the people of each territory enact that every free white male inhabitant of the same above the age of 21 year be an actual resident thereof and possess the qualification hereafter describe should be entitle to vote at the first election and be eligible to any office within the territory but that the qualification of voter and hold office at all subsequent election should be such as might be prescribe by the legislative assembly provide however that the right of suffrage and of hold office should be exercise only by citizen of the united states and those who should have declare on oath their intention to become such and have take an oath to support the constitution of the united states and the provision of the act and provide far that no officer soldier seaman or marine or other person in the army or navy of the united states or attach to troop in their service should be allow to vote or hold office in either territory by reason of be on service therein
 such of the public officer of the territories as by the provision of the act be to be appoint by the general government include the governor be appoint and commission in due season the law having be enact on the 30th of may 1854 and the commission of the governor of the territory of nebraska be date on the 2d day of august 1854 and of the territory of kansas on the 29th day of june 1854 among the duty impose by the act on the governor be that of direct and superintend the political organization of the respective territories
 the governor of kansas be require to cause a census or enumeration of the inhabitant and qualified voter of the several county and district of the territory to be take by such person and in such mode as he might designate and appoint to appoint and direct the time and place of hold the first election and the manner of conduct they both as to the person to superintend such election and the return thereof to declare the number of the member of the council and the house of representative for each county or district to declare what person might appear to be duly elect and to appoint the time and place of the first meeting of the legislative assembly in substance the same duty be devolve on the governor of nebraska
 while by this act the principle of constitution for each of the territories be one and the same and the detail of organic legislation regard both be as nearly as could be identical and while the territory of nebraska be tranquilly and successfully organize in the due course of law and its first legislative assembly meet on the 16th of january 1855 the organization of kansas be long delay and have be attend with serious difficulty and embarrassment partly the consequence of local maladministration and partly of the unjustifiable interference of the inhabitant of some of the states foreign by residence interest and right to the territory
 the governor of the territory of kansas commission as before state on the 29th of june 1854 do not reach the designate seat of his government until the 7th of the ensue october and even then fail to make the first step in its legal organization that of order the census or enumeration of its inhabitant until so late a day that the election of the member of the legislative assembly do not take place until the 30th of march 1855 nor its meeting until the 2d of july 1855 so that for a year after the territory be constitute by the act of congress and the officer to be appoint by the federal executive have be commission it be without a complete government without any legislative authority without local law and of course without the ordinary guaranty of peace and public order
 in other respect the governor instead of exercise constant vigilance and put forth all his energy to prevent or counteract the tendency to illegality which be prone to exist in all imperfectly organize and newly associate community allow his attention to be divert from official obligation by other object and himself set an example of the violation of law in the performance of act which render it my duty in the sequel to remove he from the office of chief executive magistrate of the territory
 before the requisite preparation be accomplish for election of a territorial legislature an election of delegate to congress have be hold in the territory on the 29th day of november 1854 and the delegate take his seat in the house of representatives without challenge it arrangement have be perfect by the governor so that the election for member of the legislative assembly might be hold in the several precinct at the same time as for delegate to congress any question appertain to the qualification of the person vote as people of the territory would have pass necessarily and at once under the supervision of congress as the judge of the validity of the return of the delegate and would have be determine before conflicting passion have become inflame by time and before opportunity could have be afford for systematic interference of the people of individual states
 this interference in so far as concern its primary cause and its immediate commencement be one of the incident of that pernicious agitation on the subject of the condition of the colored person hold to service in some of the states which have so long disturb the repose of our country and excited individual otherwise patriotic and law abide to toil with misdirect zeal in the attempt to propagate their social theory by the perversion and abuse of the power of congress
 the person and the party whom the tenor of the act to organize the territories of nebraska and kansas thwart in the endeavor to impose through the agency of congress their particular view of social organization on the people of the future new states now perceive that the policy of leave the inhabitant of each state to judge for themselves in this respect be ineradicably root in the conviction of the people of the union then have recourse in the pursuit of their general object to the extraordinary measure of propagandist colonization of the territory of kansas to prevent the free and natural action of its inhabitant in its internal organization and thus to anticipate or to force the determination of that question in this inchoate state
 with such view association be organize in some of the states and their purpose be proclaim through the press in language extremely irritate and offensive to those of whom the colonist be to become the neighbor those design and act have the necessary consequence to awaken emotion of intense indignation in states near to the territory of kansas and especially in the adjoining state of missouri whose domestic peace be thus the most directly endanger but they be far from justify the illegal and reprehensible countermovement which ensue
 under these inauspicious circumstance the primary election for member of the legislative assembly be hold in most if not all of the precinct at the time and the place and by the person designate and appoint by the governor accord to law
 angry accusation that illegal vote have be poll abound on all side and imputation be make both of fraud and violence but the governor in the exercise of the power and the discharge of the duty confer and impose by law on he alone officially receive and consider the return declare a large majority of the member of the council and the house of representative duly elect withhold certificate from other because of alleged illegality of vote appoint a new election to supply the place of the person not certify and thus at length in all the form of statute and with his own official authentication complete legality be give to the first legislative assembly of the territory
 those decision of the return officer and of the governor be final except that by the parliamentary usage of the country apply to the organic law it may be concede that each house of the assembly must have be competent to determine in the last resort the qualification and the election of its member the subject be by its nature one appertain exclusively to the jurisdiction of the local authority of the territory whatever irregularity may have occur in the election it seem too late now to raise that question at all event it be a question as to which neither now nor at any previous time have the least possible legal authority be possess by the president of the united states for all present purpose the legislative body thus constitute and elect be the legitimate legislative assembly of the territory
 accordingly the governor by proclamation convene the assembly thus elect to meet at a place call pawnee city the two house meet and be duly organize in the ordinary parliamentary form each send to and receive from the governor the official communication usual on such occasion an elaborate message open the session be communicate by the governor and the general business of legislation be enter upon by the legislative assembly
 but after a few day the assembly resolve to adjourn to another place in the territory a law be accordingly pass against the consent of the governor but in due form otherwise to remove the seat of government temporarily to the shawnee manual labor school or mission and thither the assembly proceed after this receive a bill for the establishment of a ferry at the town of kickapoo the governor refuse to sign it and by special message assign for reason of refusal not anything objectionable in the bill itself nor any pretense of the illegality or incompetency of the assembly as such but only the fact that the assembly have by its act transfer the seat of government temporarily from pawnee city to the shawnee mission for the same reason he continue to refuse to sign other bill until in the course of a few day he by official message communicate to the assembly the fact that he have receive notification of the termination of his function as governor and that the duty of the office be legally devolve on the secretary of the territory thus to the last recognize the body as a duly elect and constitute legislative assembly
 it will be perceive that if any constitutional defect attach to the legislative act of the assembly it be not pretend to consist in irregularity of election or want of qualification of the member but only in the change of its place of session however trivial this objection may seem to be it require to be consider because upon it be round all that superstructure of act plainly against law which now threaten the peace not only of the territory of kansas but of the union
 such an objection to the proceeding of the legislative assembly be of exceptionable origin for the reason that by the express term of the organic law the seat of government of the territory be locate temporarily at fort leavenworth and yet the governor himself remain there less than two month and of his own discretion transfer the seat of government to the shawnee mission where it in fact be at the time the assembly be call to meet at pawnee city if the governor have any such right to change temporarily the seat of government still more have the legislative assembly the objection be of exceptionable origin for the further reason that the place indicate by the governor without have any exclusive claim of preference in itself be a propose town site only which he and other be attempt to locate unlawfully upon land within a military reservation and for participation in which illegal act the commandant of the post a superior officer in the army have be dismiss by sentence of court martial nor be it easy to see why the legislative assembly might not with propriety pass the territorial act transfer its sitting to the shawnee mission if it could not that must be on account of some prohibitory or incompatible provision of act of congress but no such provision exist the organic act as already quote say the seat of government be hereby locate temporarily at fort leavenworth and it then provide that certain of the public building there may be occupy and use under the direction of the governor and legislative assembly these expression might possibly be construe to imply that when in a previous section of the act it be enact that the first legislative assembly shall meet at such place and on such day as the governor shall appoint the word place mean place at fort leavenworth not place anywhere in the territory if so the governor would have be the first to err in this matter not only in himself having remove the seat of government to the shawnee mission but in again remove it to pawnee city if there be any departure from the letter of the law therefore it be his in both instance but however this may be it be most unreasonable to suppose that by the term of the organic act congress intend to do impliedly what it have not do expressly that be to forbid to the legislative assembly the power to choose any place it might see fit as the temporary seat of its deliberation that be prove by the significant language of one of the subsequent act of congress on the subject that of march 3 1855 -which in make appropriation for public building of the territory enact that the same shall not be expend until the legislature of say territory shall have fix by law the permanent seat of government congress in these expression do not profess to be grant the power to fix the permanent seat of government but recognize the power as one already grant but how undoubtedly by the comprehensive provision of the organic act itself which declare that the legislative power of the territory shall extend to all rightful subject of legislation consistent with the constitution of the united states and the provision of this act if in view of this act the legislative assembly have the large power to fix the permanent seat of government at any place in its discretion of course by the same enactment it have the less and the include power to fix it temporarily
 nevertheless the allegation that the act of the legislative assembly be illegal by reason of this removal of its place of session be bring forward to justify the first great movement in disregard of law within the territory one of the act of the legislative assembly provide for the election of a delegate to the present congress and a delegate be elect under that law but subsequently to this a portion of the people of the territory proceed without authority of law to elect another delegate
 follow upon this movement be another and more important one of the same general character person confessedly not constitute the body politic or all the inhabitant but merely a party of the inhabitant and without law have undertake to summon a convention for the purpose of transform the territory into a state and have frame a constitution adopt it and under it elect a governor and other officer and a representative to congress in extenuation of these illegal act it be allege that the states of california michigan and other be self organize and as such be admit into the union without a previous enable act of congress it be true that while in a majority of case a previous act of congress have be pass to authorize the territory to present itself as a state and that this be deem the most regular course yet such an act have not be hold to be indispensable and in some case the territory have proceed without it and have nevertheless be admit into the union as a state it lie with congress to authorize beforehand or to confirm afterwards in its discretion but in no instance have a state be admit upon the application of person act against authority duly constitute by act of congress in every case it be the people of the territory not a party among they who have the power to form a constitution and ask for admission as a state no principle of public law no practice or precedent under the constitution of the united states no rule of reason right or common sense confer any such power as that now claim by a mere party in the territory in fact what have be do be of revolutionary character it be avowedly so in motive and in aim as respect the local law of the territory it will become treasonable insurrection if it reach the length of organize resistance by force to the fundamental or any other federal law and to the authority of the general government in such an event the path of duty for the executive be plain the constitution require he to take care that the law of the united states be faithfully execute if they be oppose in the territory of kansas he may and should place at the disposal of the marshal any public force of the united states which happen to be within the jurisdiction to be use as a portion of the posse comitatus and if that do not suffice to maintain order then he may call forth the militia of one or more state for that object or employ for the same object any part of the land or naval force of the united states so also if the obstruction be to the law of the territory and it be duly present to he as a case of insurrection he may employ for its suppression the militia of any state or the land or naval force of the united states and if the territory be invade by the citizen of other states whether for the purpose of decide election or for any other and the local authority find themselves unable to repel or withstand it they will be entitle to and upon the fact be fully ascertain they shall most certainly receive the aid of the general government
 but it be not the duty of the president of the united states to volunteer interposition by force to preserve the purity of election either in a state or territory to do so would be subversive of public freedom and whether a law be wise or unwise just or unjust be not a question for he to judge if it be constitutional that be if it be the law of the land it be his duty to cause it to be execute or to sustain the authority of any state or territory in execute it in opposition to all insurrectionary movement
 our system afford no justification of revolutionary act for the constitutional mean of relieve the people of unjust administration and law by a change of public agent and by repeal be ample and more prompt and effective than illegal violence these mean must be scrupulously guard this great prerogative of popular sovereignty sacredly respect
 it be the undoubted right of the peaceable and orderly people of the territory of kansas to elect their own legislative body make their own law and regulate their own social institution without foreign or domestic molestation interference on the one hand to procure the abolition or prohibition of slave labor in the territory have produce mischievous interference on the other for its maintenance or introduction one wrong beget another statement entirely unfounded or grossly exaggerated concern event within the territory be sedulously diffuse through remote states to feed the flame of sectional animosity there and the agitator there exert themselves indefatigably in return to encourage and stimulate strife within the territory
 the inflammatory agitation of which the present be but a part have for twenty year produce nothing save unmitigated evil north and south but for it the character of the domestic institution of the future new state would have be a matter of too little interest to the inhabitant of the contiguous state personally or collectively to produce among they any political emotion climate soil production hope of rapid advancement and the pursuit of happiness on the part of the settler themselves with good wish but with no interference from without would have quietly determine the question which be at this time of such disturbing character
 but we be constrain to turn our attention to the circumstance of embarrassment as they now exist it be the duty of the people of kansas to discountenance every act or purpose of resistance to its law above all the emergency appeal to the citizen of the states and especially of those contiguous to the territory neither by intervention of nonresident in election nor by unauthorized military force to attempt to encroach upon or usurp the authority of the inhabitant of the territory
 no citizen of our country should permit himself to forget that he be a part of its government and entitle to be hear in the determination of its policy and its measure and that therefore the high consideration of personal honor and patriotism require he to maintain by whatever of power or influence he may possess the integrity of the law of the republic
 entertain these view it will be my imperative duty to exert the whole power of the federal executive to support public order in the territory to vindicate its law whether federal or local against all attempt of organize resistance and so to protect its people in the establishment of their own institution undisturbe by encroachment from without and in the full enjoyment of the right of self government assure to they by the constitution and the organic act of congress
 although serious and threatening disturbance in the territory of kansas announce to i by the governor in december last be speedily quiet without the effusion of blood and in a satisfactory manner there be i regret to say reason to apprehend that disorder will continue to occur there with increase tendency to violence until some decisive measure be take to dispose of the question itself which constitute the inducement or occasion of internal agitation and of external interference
 this it seem to i can well be accomplish by provide that when the inhabitant of kansas may desire it and shall be of sufficient number to constitute a state a convention of delegate duly elect by the qualified voter shall assemble to frame a constitution and thus to prepare through regular and lawful mean for its admission into the union as a state
 i respectfully recommend the enactment of a law to that effect
 i recommend also that a special appropriation be make to defray any expense which may become requisite in the execution of the law or the maintenance of public order in the territory of kansas

by the president of the united states of america
 a proclamation
 whereas indication exist that public tranquillity and the supremacy of law in the territory of kansas be endanger by the reprehensible act or purpose of person both within and without the same who propose to direct and control its political organization by force it appear that combination have be form therein to resist the execution of the territorial law and thus in effect subvert by violence all present constitutional and legal authority it also appear that person reside without the territory but near its border contemplate armed intervention in the affair thereof it also appear that other person inhabitant of remote states be collect money engage man and provide arm for the same purpose and it far appear that combination within the territory be endeavor by the agency of emissary and otherwise to induce individual states of the union to intervene in the affair thereof in violation of the constitution of the united states and
 whereas all such plan for the determination of the future institution of the territory if carry into action from within the same will constitute the fact of insurrection and if from without that of invasive aggression and will in either case justify and require the forcible interposition of the whole power of the general government as well to maintain the law of the territory as those of the union
 now therefore i franklin pierce president of the united states do issue this my proclamation to command all person engage in unlawful combination against the constitute authority of the territory of kansas or of the united states to disperse and retire peaceably to their respective abode and to warn all such person that any attempt insurrection in say territory or aggressive intrusion into the same will be resist not only by the employment of the local militia but also by that of any available force of the united states to the end of assure immunity from violence and full protection to the person property and civil right of all peaceable and law abide inhabitant of the territory
 if in any part of the union the fury of faction or fanaticism inflame into disregard of the great principle of popular sovereignty which under the constitution be fundamental in the whole structure of our institution be to bring on the country the dire calamity of an arbitrament of arm in that territory it shall be between lawless violence on the one side and conservative force on the other wield by legal authority of the general government
 i call on the citizen both of adjoining and of distant states to abstain from unauthorized intermeddling in the local concern of the territory admonish they that its organic law be to be execute with impartial justice that all individual act of illegal interference will incur condign punishment and that any endeavor to intervene by organized force will be firmly withstood
 i invoke all good citizen to promote order by render obedience to the law to seek remedy for temporary evil by peaceful mean to discountenance and repulse the counsel and the instigation of agitator and of disorganizer and to testify their attachment to their country their pride in its greatness their appreciation of the blessing they enjoy and their determination that republican institution shall not fail in their hand by cooperate to uphold the majesty of the law and to vindicate the sanctity of the constitution
 in testimony whereof i have hereunto set my hand and cause the seal of the united states to be affix to these present
 do at the city of washington the 11th day of february a.d. 1856 and of the independence of the united states the eightieth
 franklin pierce
 by the president
 w. l. marcy
 secretary of state

fellow citizen of the senate and house of representatives
 in consequence of the failure of congress at its recent session to make provision for the support of the army it become imperatively incumbent on i to exercise the power which the constitution confer on the executive for extraordinary occasion and promptly to convene the two houses in order to afford they an opportunity of reconsider a subject of such vital interest to the peace and welfare of the union
 with the exception of a partial authority vest by law in the secretary of war to contract for the supply of clothing and subsistence the army be wholly dependent on the appropriation annually make by congress the omission of congress to act in this respect before the termination of the fiscal year have already cause embarrassment to the service which be overcome only in expectation of appropriation before the close of the present month if the requisite fund be not speedily provide the executive will no long be able to furnish the transportation equipment and munition which be essential to the effectiveness of a military force in the field with no provision for the pay of troop the contract of enlistment would be break and the army must in effect be disband the consequence of which would be so disastrous as to demand all possible effort to avert the calamity
 it be not merely that the officer and enlisted man of the army be to be thus deprive of the pay and emolument to which they be entitle by stand law that the construction of arm at the public armory the repair and construction of ordnance at the arsenal and the manufacture of military clothing and camp equipage must be discontinue and the person connect with this branch of the public service thus be deprive suddenly of the employment essential to their subsistence nor be it merely the waste consequent on the force abandonment of the seaboard fortification and of the interior military post and other establishment and the enormous expense of recruit and reorganize the army and again distribute it over the vast region which it now occupy these be evil which may it be true be repair hereafter by taxis impose on the country but other evil be involve which no expenditure however lavish could remedy in comparison with which local and personal injury or interest sink into insignificance
 a great part of the army be situate on the remote frontier or in the desert and mountain of the interior to discharge large body of man in such place without the mean of regain their home and where few if any could obtain subsistence by honest industry would be to subject they to suffer and temptation with disregard of justice and right most derogatory to the government
 in the territories of washington and oregon numerous band of indians be in arm and be wage a war of extermination against the white inhabitant and although our troop be actively carry on the campaign we have no intelligence as yet of a successful result on the western plain notwithstanding the impose display of military force recently make there and the chastisement inflict on the rebellious tribe other far from be dismay have manifest hostile intention and be guilty of outrage which if not design to provoke a conflict serve to show that the apprehension of it be insufficient wholly to restrain their vicious propensity a strong force in the state of texas have produce a temporary suspension of hostility there but in new mexico incessant activity on the part of the troop be require to keep in check the maraud tribe which infest that territory the hostile indians have not be remove from the state of florida and the withdrawal of the troop therefrom leave that object unaccomplished would be most injurious to the inhabitant and a breach of the positive engagement of the general government
 to refuse supply to the army therefore be to compel the complete cessation of all its operation and its practical disbandment and thus to invite horde of predatory savage from the western plain and the rocky mountains to spread devastation along a frontier of more than 4,000 mile in extent and to deliver up the sparse population of a vast tract of country to rapine and murder
 such in substance would be the direct and immediate effect of the refusal of congress for the first time in the history of the government to grant supply for the maintenance of the army the inevitable waste of million of public treasure the infliction of extreme wrong upon all person connect with the military establishment by service employment or contract the recall of our force from the field the fearful sacrifice of life and incalculable destruction of property on the remote frontier the striking of our national flag on the battlement of the fortress which defend our maritime city against foreign invasion the violation of the public honor and good faith and the discredit of the united states in the eye of the civilized world
 i confidently trust that these consideration and other appertain to the domestic peace of the country which can not fail to suggest themselves to every patriotic mind will on reflection be duly appreciate by both houses of congress and induce the enactment of the requisite provision of law for the support of the army of the united states

fellow citizen of the senate and of the house of representatives the constitution require that the president shall from time to time not only recommend to the consideration of congress such measure as he may judge necessary and expedient but also that he shall give information to they of the state of the union to do this fully involve exposition of all matter in the actual condition of the country domestic or foreign which essentially concern the general welfare while perform his constitutional duty in this respect the president do not speak merely to express personal conviction but as the executive minister of the government enable by his position and call upon by his official obligation to scan with an impartial eye the interest of the whole and of every part of the united states of the condition of the domestic interest of the union its agriculture mine manufacture navigation and commerce it be necessary only to say that the internal prosperity of the country its continuous and steady advancement in wealth and population and in private as well as public well being attest the wisdom of our institution and the predominant spirit of intelligence and patriotism which notwithstanding occasional irregularity of opinion or action result from popular freedom have distinguish and characterize the people of america in the brief interval between the termination of the last and the commencement of the present session of congress the public mind have be occupy with the care of select for another constitutional term the president and vice president of the united states the determination of the person who be of right or contingently to preside over the administration of the government be under our system commit to the states and the people we appeal to they by their voice pronounce in the form of law to call whomsoever they will to the high post of chief magistrate and thus it be that as the senator represent the respective states of the union and the member of the house of representatives the several constituency of each state so the president represent the aggregate population of the united states their election of he be the explicit and solemn act of the sole sovereign authority of the union it be impossible to misapprehend the great principle which by their recent political action the people of the united states have sanction and announce they have assert the constitutional equality of each and all of the states of the union as states they have affirm the constitutional equality of each and all of the citizen of the united states as citizen whatever their religion wherever their birth or their residence they have maintain the inviolability of the constitutional right of the different section of the union and they have proclaim their devoted and unalterable attachment to the union and to the constitution as object of interest superior to all subject of local or sectional controversy as the safeguard of the right of all as the spirit and the essence of the liberty peace and greatness of the republic in do this they have at the same time emphatically condemn the idea of organize in these united states mere geographical party of marshal in hostile array toward each other the different part of the country north or south east or west scheme of this nature fraught with incalculable mischief and which the considerate sense of the people have reject could have have countenance in no part of the country have they not be disguise by suggestion plausible in appearance act upon an excited state of the public mind induce by cause temporary in their character and it be to be hope transient in their influence perfect liberty of association for political object and the wide scope of discussion be the received and ordinary condition of government in our country our institution frame in the spirit of confidence in the intelligence and integrity of the people do not forbid citizen either individually or associate together to attack by writing speech or any other method short of physical force the constitution and the very existence of the union under the shelter of this great liberty and protect by the law and usage of the government they assail association have be form in some of the states of individual who pretend to seek only to prevent the spread of the institution of slavery into the present or future inchoate states of the union be really inflame with desire to change the domestic institution of exist state to accomplish their object they dedicate themselves to the odious task of depreciate the government organization which stand in their way and of calumniate with indiscriminate invective not only the citizen of particular states with whose law they find fault but all other of their fellow citizen throughout the country who do not participate with they in their assault upon the constitution frame and adopt by our father and claim for the privilege it have secure and the blessing it have confer the steady support and grateful reverence of their child they seek an object which they well know to be a revolutionary one they be perfectly aware that the change in the relative condition of the white and black race in the slaveholding states which they would promote be beyond their lawful authority that to they it be a foreign object that it can not be effect by any peaceful instrumentality of theirs that for they and the states of which they be citizen the only path to its accomplishment be through burn city and ravage field and slaughter population and all there be most terrible in foreign complicated with civil and servile war and that the first step in the attempt be the forcible disruption of a country embrace in its broad bosom a degree of liberty and an amount of individual and public prosperity to which there be no parallel in history and substitute in its place hostile government drive at once and inevitably into mutual devastation and fratricidal carnage transform the now peaceful and felicitous brotherhood into a vast permanent camp of armed man like the rival monarchy of europe and asia well know that such and such only be the mean and the consequence of their plan and purpose they endeavor to prepare the people of the united states for civil war by do everything in their power to deprive the constitution and the law of moral authority and to undermine the fabric of the union by appeal to passion and sectional prejudice by indoctrinate its people with reciprocal hatred and by educate they to stand face to face as enemy rather than shoulder to shoulder as friend it be by the agency of such unwarrantable interference foreign and domestic that the mind of many otherwise good citizen have be so inflame into the passionate condemnation of the domestic institution of the southern states as at length to pass insensibly to almost equally passion late hostility toward their fellow citizen of those states and thus finally to fall into temporary fellowship with the avowed and active enemy of the constitution ardently attach to liberty in the abstract they do not stop to consider practically how the object they would attain can be accomplish nor to reflect that even if the evil be as great as they deem it they have no remedy to apply and that it can be only aggravate by their violence and unconstitutional action a question which be one of the most difficult of all the problem of social institution political economy and statesmanship they treat with unreasone intemperance of thought and language extreme beget extreme violent attack from the north find its inevitable consequence in the growth of a spirit of angry defiance at the south thus in the progress of event we have reach that consummation which the voice of the people have now so pointedly rebuke of the attempt of a portion of the states by a sectional organization and movement to usurp the control of the government of the united states i confidently believe that the great body of those who inconsiderately take this fatal step be sincerely attach to the constitution and the union they would upon deliberation shrink with unaffected horror from any conscious act of disunion or civil war but they have enter into a path which lead nowhere unless it be to civil war and disunion and which have no other possible outlet they have proceed thus far in that direction in consequence of the successive stage of their progress having consist of a series of secondary issue each of which profess to be confine within constitutional and peaceful limit but which attempt indirectly what few man be willing to do directly that be to act aggressively against the constitutional right of nearly one half of the thirty one state in the long series of act of indirect aggression the first be the strenuous agitation by citizen of the northern states in congress and out of it of the question of negro emancipation in the southern states the second step in this path of evil consist of act of the people of the northern states and in several instance of their government aim to facilitate the escape of person hold to service in the southern states and to prevent their extradition when reclaim accord to law and in virtue of express provision of the constitution to promote this object legislative enactment and other mean be adopt to take away or defeat right which the constitution solemnly guarantee in order to nullify the then exist act of congress concern the extradition of fugitive from service law be enact in many state forbid their officer under the severe penalty to participate in the execution of any act of congress whatever in this way that system of harmonious cooperation between the authority of the united states and of the several states for the maintenance of their common institution which exist in the early year of the republic be destroy conflict of jurisdiction come to be frequent and congress find itself difficulty domestic and foreign and which enable i to contemplate the spectacle of amicable and respectful relation between our and all other government and the establishment of constitutional order and tranquillity throughout the union
