after a delay which have afford i ample time for reflection and after much and careful deliberation i find myself constrain by an imperious sense of duty as a coordinate branch of the federal government to protest against the first two clause of the first resolution adopt by the house of representatives on the 5th instant and publish in the congressional globe on the succeed day these clause be in the following word
 resolve that a committee of five member be appoint by the speaker for the purpose first of investigate whether the president of the united states or any other officer of the government have by money patronage or other improper mean seek to influence the action of congress or any committee thereof for or against the passage of any law appertain to the right of any state or territory and second also to inquire into and investigate whether any officer or officer of the government have by combination or otherwise prevent or defeat or attempt to prevent or defeat the execution of any law or law now upon the statute book and whether the president have fail or refuse to compel the execution of any law thereof
 i confine myself exclusively to these two branch of the resolution because the portion of it which follow relate to allege abuse in post office navy yard public building and other public work of the united states in such case inquiry be highly proper in themselves and belong equally to the senate and the house as incident to their legislative duty and be necessary to enable they to discover and to provide the appropriate legislative remedy for any abuse which may be ascertain although the term of the latter portion of the resolution be extremely vague and general yet my sole purpose in advert to they at present be to mark the broad line of distinction between the accusatory and the remedial clause of this resolution the house of representatives possess no power under the constitution over the first or accusatory portion of the resolution except as an impeach body whilst over the last in common with the senate their authority as a legislative body be fully and cheerfully admit
 it be solely in reference to the first or impeach power that i propose to make a few observation except in this single case the constitution have invest the house of representatives with no power no jurisdiction no supremacy whatever over the president in all other respect he be quite as independent of they as they be of he as a coordinate branch of the government he be their equal indeed he be the only direct representative on earth of the people of all and each of the sovereign states to they and to they alone be he responsible whilst act within the sphere of his constitutional duty and not in any manner to the house of representatives the people have think proper to invest he with the most honorable responsible and dignified office in the world and the individual however unworthy now hold this exalt position will take care so far as in he lie that their right and prerogative shall never be violate in his person but shall pass to his successor unimpaire by the adoption of a dangerous precedent he will defend they to the last extremity against any unconstitutional attempt come from what quarter it may to abridge the constitutional right of the executive and render he subservient to any human power except themselves
 the people have not confine the president to the exercise of executive duty they have also confer upon he a large measure of legislative discretion no bill can become a law without his approval as represent the people of the united states unless it shall pass after his veto by a majority of two third of both houses in his legislative capacity he might in common with the senate and the house institute an inquiry to ascertain any fact which ought to influence his judgment in approve or veto any bill
 this participation in the performance of legislative duty between the coordinate branch of the government ought to inspire the conduct of all of they in their relation toward each other with mutual forbearance and respect at least each have a right to demand justice from the other the cause of complaint be that the constitutional right and immunity of the executive have be violate in the person of the president
 the trial of an impeachment of the president before the senate on charge prefer and prosecute against he by the house of representatives would be an impose spectacle for the world in the result not only his removal from the presidential office would be involve but what be of infinitely great importance to himself his character both in the eye of the present and of future generation might possibly be tarnish the disgrace cast upon he would in some degree be reflect upon the character of the american people who elect he hence the precaution adopt by the constitution to secure a fair trial on such a trial it declare that the chief justice shall preside this be doubtless because the framer of the constitution believe it to be possible that the vice president might be bias by the fact that in case of the removal of the president from office the same shall devolve on the vice president
 the preliminary proceeding in the house in the case of charge which may involve impeachment have be well and wisely settle by long practice upon principle of equal justice both to the accuse and to the people the precedent establish in the case of judge peck of missouri in 1831 after a careful review of all former precedent will i venture to predict stand the test of time
 in that case luke edward lawless the accuser present a petition to the house in which he set forth minutely and specifically his cause of complaint he pray that the conduct and proceeding in this behalf of say judge peck may be inquire into by your honorable body and such decision make thereon as to your wisdom and justice shall seem proper this petition be refer to the judiciary committee such have ever be deem the appropriate committee to make similar investigation it be a stand committee suppose to be appoint without reference to any special case and at all time be presume to be compose of the most eminent lawyer in the house from different portion of the union whose acquaintance with judicial proceeding and whose habit of investigation qualify they peculiarly for the task no tribunal from their position and character could in the nature of thing be more impartial in the case of judge peck the witness be select by the committee itself with a view to ascertain the truth of the charge they be cross examine by he and everything be conduct in such a manner as to afford he no reasonable cause of complaint in view of this precedent and what be of far great importance in view of the constitution and the principle of eternal justice in what manner have the president of the united states be treat by the house of representatives mr. john covode a representative from pennsylvania be the accuser of the president instead of follow the wise precedent of former time and especially that in the case of judge peck and refer the accusation to the committee on the judiciary the house have make my accuser one of my judge
 to make the accuser the judge be a violation of the principle of universal justice and be condemn by the practice of all civilized nation every freeman must revolt at such a spectacle i be to appear before mr. covode either personally or by a substitute to cross examine the witness which he may produce before himself to sustain his own accusation against i and perhaps even this poor boon may be deny to the president
 and what be the nature of the investigation which his resolution propose to institute it be as vague and general as the english language afford word in which to make it the committee be to inquire not into any specific charge or charge but whether the president have by money patronage or other improper mean seek to influence not the action of any individual member or member of congress but the action of the entire body of congress itself or any committee thereof the president might have have some glimmering of the nature of the offense to be investigate have his accuser point to the act or act of congress which he seek to pass or to defeat by the employment of money patronage or other improper mean but the accusation be bound by no such limit it extend to the whole circle of legislation to interference for or against the passage of any law appertain to the right of any state or territory and what law do not appertain to the right of some state or territory and what law or law have the president fail to execute these might easily have be point out have any such existed
 have mr. lawless ask an inquiry to be make by the house whether judge peck in general term have not violate his judicial duty without the specification of any particular act i do not believe there would have be a single vote in that body in favor of the inquiry
 since the time of the star chamber and of general warrant there have be no such proceeding in england
 the house of representatives the high impeach power of the country without consent to hear a word of explanation have indorse this accusation against the president and make it their own act they even refuse to permit a member to inquire of the president&#39;s accuser what be the specific charge against he thus in this preliminary accusation of high crime and misdemeanor against a coordinate branch of the government under the impeach power the house refuse to hear a single suggestion even in regard to the correct mode of proceeding but without a moment&#39;s delay pass the accusatory resolution under the pressure of the previous question
 in the institution of a prosecution for any offense against the most humble citizen and i claim for myself no great right than he enjoy the constitution of the united states and of the several states require that he shall be inform in the very beginning of the nature and cause of the accusation against he in order to enable he to prepare for his defense there be other principle which i might enumerate not less sacred present an impenetrable shield to protect every citizen falsely charge with a criminal offense these have be violate in the prosecution institute by the house of representatives against the executive branch of the government shall the president alone be deprive of the protection of these great principle which prevail in every land where a ray of liberty penetrate the gloom of despotism shall the executive alone be deprive of right which all his fellow citizen enjoy the whole proceeding against he justify the fear of those wise and great man who before the constitution be adopt by the states apprehend that the tendency of the government be to the aggrandizement of the legislative at the expense of the executive and judicial department
 i again declare emphatically that i make this protest for no reason personal to myself and i do it with perfect respect for the house of representatives in which i have the honor of serve as a member for five successive term i have live long in this goodly land and have enjoy all the office and honor which my country could bestow amid all the political storm through which i have pass the present be the first attempt which have ever be make to my knowledge to assail my personal or official integrity and this as the time be approach when i shall voluntarily retire from the service of my country i feel proudly conscious that there be no public act of my life which will not bear the strict scrutiny i defy all investigation nothing but the basest perjury can sully my good name i do not fear even this because i cherish an humble confidence that the gracious being who have hitherto defend and protect i against the shaft of falsehood and malice will not desert i now when i have become old and gray head i can declare before god and my country that no human being with an exception scarcely worthy of notice have at any period of my life dare to approach i with a corrupt or dishonorable proposition and until recent development it have never enter into my imagination that any person even in the storm of exasperate political excitement would charge i in the most remote degree with having make such a proposition to any human being i may now however exclaim in the language of complaint employ by my first and great predecessor that i have be abuse in such exaggerated and indecent term as could scarcely be apply to a nero to a notorious defaulter or even to a common pickpocket
 i do therefore for the reason state and in the name of the people of the several states solemnly protest against these proceeding of the house of representatives because they be in violation of the right of the coordinate executive branch of the government and subversive of its constitutional independence because they be calculate to foster a band of interested parasite and informer ever ready for their own advantage to swear before ex parte committee to pretend private conversation between the president and themselves incapable from their nature of be disprove thus furnish material for harass he degrade he in the eye of the country and eventually should he be a weak or a timid man render he subservient to improper influence in order to avoid such persecution and annoyance because they tend to destroy that harmonious action for the common good which ought to be maintain and which i sincerely desire to cherish between coordinate branch of the government and finally because if unresisted they would establish a precedent dangerous and embarrassing to all my successor to whatever political party they might be attach

on the 26th day of april last lieutenant craven of the united states steamer mohawk capture the slaver wildfire on the coast of cuba with 507 african negro on board the prize be bring into key west on the 31st april and the negro be deliver into the custody of fernando j. moreno marshal of the southern district of florida
 the question which now demand immediate decision be what disposition shall be make of these africans in the annual message to congress of december 6 1858 i express my opinion in regard to the construction of the act of the 3d march 1819 in addition to the act prohibit the slave trade so far as the same be applicable to the present case from this i make the following extract
 under the second section of this act the president be authorize to make such regulation and arrangement as he may deem expedient for the safe keeping support and removal beyond the limit of the united states of all such negro mulattoe or person of color capture by vessel of the united states as may be deliver to the marshal of the district into which they be bring and to appoint a proper person or person reside upon the coast of africa as agent or agent for receive the negro mulattoe or person of color deliver from on board vessel seize in the prosecution of the slave trade by commander of united states armed vessel
 a doubt immediately arise as to the true construction of this act it be quite clear from its term that the president be authorize to provide for the safe keeping support and removal of these negro up till the time of their delivery to the agent on the coast of africa but no express provision be make for their protection and support after they have reach the place of their destination still an agent be to be appoint to receive they in africa and it could not have be suppose that congress intend he should desert they at the moment they be receive and turn they loose on that inhospitable coast to perish for want of food or to become again the victim of the slave trade have this be the intention of congress the employment of an agent to receive they who be require to reside on the coast be unnecessary and they might have be land by our vessel anywhere in africa and leave expose to the suffering and the fate which would certainly await they
 mr. monroe in his special message of december 17 1819 at the first session after the act be pass announce to congress what in his opinion be its true construction he believe it to be his duty under it to follow these unfortunate into africa and make provision for they there until they should be able to provide for themselves in communicate this interpretation of the act to congress he state that some doubt have be entertain as to its true intent and meaning and he submit the question to they so that they might should it be deem advisable amend the same before further proceeding be have under it nothing be do by congress to explain the act and mr. monroe proceed to carry it into execution accord to his own interpretation this then become the practical construction
 adopt this construction of president monroe i enter into an agreement with the colonization society date 7th september 1858 to receive the africans which have be capture on the slaver echo from the agent of the united states in liberia to furnish they during the period of one year thereafter with comfortable shelter clothing and provision and to cause they to be instruct in the art of civilized life suitable to their condition at the rate of $ 150 for each individual it be believe that within that period they would be prepare to become citizen of liberia and to take care of themselves
 as congress be not then in session and as there be no outstanding appropriation applicable to this purpose the society be oblige to depend for payment on the future action of that body i recommend this appropriation and $ 75,000 be grant by the act of 3d march 1859 the consular and diplomatic bill to enable the president of the united states to carry into effect the act of congress of 3d march 1819 and any subsequent act now in force for the suppression of the slave trade of this appropriation there remain unexpended the sum of $ 24,350.90 after deduct from it an advance make by the secretary of the interior out of the judiciary fund of $ 11,348.10
 i regret to say that under the mode adopt in regard to the africans capture on board the echo the expense will be large but this seem to a great extent to be inevitable without a violation of the law of humanity the expenditure upon this scale for those capture on board the wildfire will not be less than $ 100,000 and may considerably exceed that sum still it ought to be observe that during the period when the government itself through its own agent undertake the task of provide for capture negro in africa the cost per head be much great than that which i agree to pay the colonization society
 but it will not be sufficient for congress to limit the amount appropriate to the case of the wildfire it be probable judge from the increase activity of the slave trade and the vigilance of our cruiser that several similar capture may be make before the end of the year an appropriation ought therefore to be grant large enough to cover such contingency
 the period have arrive when it be indispensable to provide some specific legislation for the guidance of the executive on this subject with this view i would suggest that congress might authorize the president to enter into a general agreement with the colonization society bind they to receive on the coast of africa from an agent there all the capture africans which may be deliver to he and to maintain they for a limited period upon such term and condition as may combine humanity toward these unfortunate with a just economy this would obviate the necessity of make a new bargain with every new capture and would prevent delay and avoid expense in the disposition of the capture the law might then provide that in all case where this may be practicable the captor should carry the negro directly to africa and deliver they to the american agent there afterwards bring the capture vessel to the united states for adjudication
 the capture officer in case he should bring his prize directly to the united states ought to be require to land the negro in some one or more port to be designate by congress where the prevail health throughout the year be good at these port cheap but permanent accommodation might be provide for the negro until they could be send away without incur the expense of erect such accommodation at every port where the capture officer may think proper to enter on the present occasion these negro have be bring to key west and accord to the estimate present by the marshal of the southern district of florida to the secretary of the interior the cost of provide temporary quarter for they will be $ 2,500 and the aggregate expense for the single month of may will amount to $ 12,000 but this be far from be the bad evil within a few week the yellow fever will most probably prevail at key west and hence the marshal urge their removal from their present quarter at an early day which must be do in any event as soon as practicable for these reason i earnestly commend this subject to the immediate attention of congress i transmit herewith a copy of the letter and estimate of fernando j. moreno marshal of the southern district of florida to the secretary of the interior date 10th may 1860 together with a copy of the letter of the secretary of the interior to myself date 16th may
 it be truly lamentable that great britain and the united states should be oblige to expend such a vast amount of blood and treasure for the suppression of the african slave trade and this when the only portion of the civilized world where it be tolerate and encourage be the spanish island of cuba and porto rico

in my message to the house of representatives of the 28th march last i solemnly protest against the creation of a committee at the head of which be place my accuser for the purpose of investigate whether the president have by money patronage or other improper mean seek to influence the action of congress or any committee thereof for or against the passage of any law appertain to the right of any state or territory i protest against this because it be destitute of any specification because it refer to no particular act to enable the president to prepare for his defense because it deprive he of the constitutional guard which in common with every citizen of the united states he possess for his protection and because it assail his constitutional independence as a coordinate branch of the government
 there be an enlightened justice as well as a beautiful symmetry in every part of the constitution this be conspicuously manifest in regard to impeachment the house of representatives possess the sole power of impeachment the senate the sole power to try all impeachment and the impeachable offense be treason bribery or other high crime or misdemeanor the practice of the house from the early time have be in accordance with its own dignity the right of the accuse and the demand of justice at the commencement of each judicial investigation which might lead to an impeachment specific charge be always prefer the accuse have an opportunity of cross examine the witness and he be place in full possession of the precise nature of the offense which he have to meet an impartial and elevated standing committee be charge with this investigation upon which no member inspire with the ancient sense of honor and justice would have serve have he ever express an opinion against the accuse until the present occasion it be never deem proper to transform the accuser into the judge and to confer upon he the selection of his own committee
 the charge make against i in vague and general term be of such a false and atrocious character that i do not entertain a moment&#39;s apprehension for the result they be abhorrent to every principle instill into i from my youth and every practice of my life and i do not believe it possible that the man exist who would so basely perjure himself as to swear to the truth of any such accusation in this conviction i be inform i have not be mistaken
 in my former protest therefore i truly and emphatically declare that it be make for no reason personal to myself but because the proceeding of the house be in violation of the right of the coordinate executive branch of the government subversive of its constitutional independence and if unresisted would establish a precedent dangerous and embarrassing to all my successor notwithstanding all this if the committee have not transcend the authority confer upon it by the resolution of the house of representatives broad and general as this be i should have remain silent upon the subject what i now charge be that they have act as though they possess unlimited power and without any warrant whatever in the resolution under which they be appoint have pursue a course not merely at war with the constitutional right of the executive but tend to degrade the presidential office itself to such a degree as to render it unworthy of the acceptance of any man of honor or principle
 the resolution of the house so far as it be accusatory of the president be confine to an inquiry whether he have use corrupt or improper mean to influence the action of congress or any of its committee on legislative measure pende before they nothing more nothing less i have not learn through the newspaper or in any other mode that the committee have touch the other accusatory branch of the resolution charge the president with a violation of duty in fail to execute some law or law this branch of the resolution be therefore out of the question by what authority then have the committee undertake to investigate the course of the president in regard to the convention which frame the lecompton constitution by what authority have they undertake to pry into our foreign relation for the purpose of assail he on account of the instruction give by the secretary of state to our minister in mexico relative to the tehuantepec route by what authority have they inquire into the cause of removal from office and this from the party themselves remove with a view to prejudice his character notwithstanding this power of removal belong exclusively to the president under the constitution be so decide by the first congress in the year 1789 and have accordingly ever since be exercise there be in the resolution no pretext of authority for the committee to investigate the question of the printing of the post office blank nor be it to be suppose that the house if ask would have grant such an authority because this question have be previously commit to two other committee one in the senate and the other in the house notwithstanding this absolute want of power the committee rush into this investigation in advance of all other subject
 the committee proceed for month from march 22 1860 to examine ex parte and without any notice to myself into every subject which could possibly affect my character interested and vindictive witness be summon and examine before they and the first and only information of their testimony which in almost every instance i receive be obtain from the publication of such portion of it as could injuriously affect myself in the new york journal it matter not that these statement be so far as i have learn disprove by the most respectable witness who happen to be on the spot the telegraph be silent respect these contradiction it be a secret committee in regard to the testimony in my defense but it be public in regard to all the testimony which could by possibility reflect on my character the poison be leave to produce its effect upon the public mind whilst the antidote be carefully withhold
 in their examination the committee violate the most sacred and honorable confidence exist among man private correspondence which a truly honorable man would never even entertain a distant thought of divulge be drag to light different person in official and confidential relation with myself and with whom it be suppose i might have hold conversation the revelation of which would do i injury be examine even member of the senate and member of my own cabinet both my constitutional adviser be call upon to testify for the purpose of discover something if possible to my discredit
 the distribution of the patronage of the government be by far the most disagreeable duty of the president applicant be so numerous and their application be press with such eagerness by their friend both in and out of congress that the selection of one for any desirable office give offense to many disappointed applicant removed officer and those who for any cause real or imaginary have become hostile to the administration present themselves or be invite by a summon to appear before the committee these be the most dangerous witness even with the good intention they be so influence by prejudice and disappointment that they almost inevitably discolor truth they swear to their own version of private conversation with the president without the possibility of contradiction his lip be seal and he be leave at their mercy he can not as a coordinate branch of the government appear before a committee of investigation to contradict the oath of such witness every coward know that he can employ insult language against the president with impunity and every false or prejudiced witness can attempt to swear away his character before such a committee without the fear of contradiction
 thus for month whilst do my good at one end of the avenue to perform my high and responsible duty to the country have there be a committee of the house of representatives in session at the other end of the avenue spread a drag net without the shadow of authority from the house over the whole union to catch any disappointed man willing to malign my character and all this in secret conclave the lion&#39; mouth at venice into which secret denunciation be drop be an apt illustration of the covode committee the star chamber tyrannical and odious as it be never proceed in such a manner for century there have be nothing like it in any civilized country except the revolutionary tribunal of france in the day of robespierre now i undertake to state and to prove that should the proceeding of the committee be sanction by the house and become a precedent for future time the balance of the constitution will be entirely upset and there will no long remain the three coordinate and independent branch of the government legislative executive and judicial the bad fear of the patriot and statesman who frame the constitution in regard to the usurpation of the legislative on the executive and judicial branch will then be realize in the language of mr. madison speak on this very subject in the forty eighth number of the federalist
 in a representative republic where the executive magistracy be carefully limited both in the extent and duration of its power and where the legislative power be exercise by an assembly which be inspire by a suppose influence over the people with an intrepid confidence in its own strength which be sufficiently numerous to feel all the passion which actuate a multitude yet not so numerous as to be incapable of pursue the object of its passion by mean which reason prescribe it be against the enterprising ambition of this department that the people ought to indulge all their jealousy and exhaust all their precaution
 and in the expressive and pointed language of mr. jefferson when speak of the tendency of the legislative branch of government to usurp the right of the weak branch
 the concentrate these in the same hand be precisely the definition of despotic government it will be no alleviation that these power will be exercise by a plurality of hand and not by a single one one hundred and seventy three despot would surely be as oppressive as one let those who doubt it turn their eye on the republic of venice as little will it avail we that they be choose by ourselves an elective despotism be not the government we fight for but one which should not only be round on free principle but in which the power of government should be so divided and balance among several body of magistracy as that no one could transcend their legal limit without be effectually check and control by the other
 should the proceeding of the covode committee become a precedent both the letter and spirit of the constitution will be violate one of the three massive column on which the whole superstructure rest will be break down instead of the executive be a coordinate it will become a subordinate branch of the government the presidential office will be drag into the dust the house of representatives will then have render the executive almost necessarily subservient to its wish instead of be independent how be it possible that two power in the state can be coordinate and independent of each other if the one claim and exercise the power to reprove and to censure all the official act and all the private conversation of the other and this upon ex parte testimony before a secret inquisitorial committee in short to assume a general censorship over the other the idea be as absurd in public as it would be in private life should the president attempt to assert and maintain his own independence future covode committee may dragoon he into submission by collect the host of disappointed office hunter removed officer and those who desire to live upon the public treasury which must follow in the wake of every administration and they in secret conclave will swear away his reputation under such circumstance he must be a very bold man should he not surrender at discretion and consent to exercise his authority accord to the will of those invest with this terrific power the sovereign people of the several states have elect he to the high and most honorable office in the world he be their only direct representative in the government by their constitution they have make he commander in chief of their army and navy he represent they in their intercourse with foreign nation clothe with their dignity and authority he occupy a proud position before all nation civilized and savage with the consent of the senate he appoint all the important officer of the government he exercise the veto power and to that extent control the legislation of congress for the performance of these high duty he be responsible to the people of the several states and not in any degree to the house of representatives
 shall he surrender these high power confer upon he as the representative of the american people for their benefit to the house to be exercise under their overshadow influence and control shall he alone of all the citizen of the united states be deny a fair trial shall he alone not be inform of the nature and cause of the accusation against he shall he alone not be confront with the witness against he shall the house of representatives usurp the power of the senate proceed to try the president through the agency of a secret committee of the body where it be impossible he can make any defense and then without afford he an opportunity of be hear pronounce a judgment of censure against he the very same rule might be apply for the very same reason to every judge of every court of the united states from what part of the constitution be this terrible secret inquisitorial power derive no such express power exist from which of the enumerate power can it be infer it be true the house can not pronounce the formal judgment against he of removal from office but they can by their judgment of censure asperse his reputation and thus to the extent of their influence render the office contemptible an example be at hand of the reckless manner in which this power of censure can be employ in high party time the house on a recent occasion have attempt to degrade the president by adopt the resolution of mr. john sherman declare that he in conjunction with the secretary of the navy by receive and consider the party relation of bidder for contract and the effect of award contract upon pende election have set an example dangerous to the public safety and deserve the reproof of this house
 it will scarcely be credit that the sole pretext for this vote of censure be the simple fact that in dispose of the numerous letter of every imaginable character which i daily receive i have in the usual course of business refer a letter from colonel patterson of philadelphia in relation to a contract to the attention of the secretary of the navy the head of the appropriate department without express or intimate any opinion whatever on the subject and to make the matter if possible still plainer the secretary have inform the committee that the president do not in any manner interfere in this case nor have he in any other case of contract since i have be in the department the absence of all proof to sustain this attempt to degrade the president whilst it manifest the venom of the shaft aim at he have destroy the vigor of the bow
 to return after this digression should the house by the institution of covode committee vote of censure and other device to harass the president reduce he to subservience to their will and render he their creature then the well balanced government which our father frame will be annihilate this conflict have already be commence in earnest by the house against the executive a bad precedent rarely if ever die it will i fear be pursue in the time of my successor no matter what may be their political character should secret committee be appoint with unlimited authority to range over all the word and action and if possible the very thought of the president with a view to discover something in his past life prejudicial to his character from parasite and informer this would be an ordeal which scarcely any mere man since the fall could endure it would be to subject he to a reign of terror from which the stout and pure heart might shrink i have pass triumphantly through this ordeal my vindication be complete the committee have report no resolution look to an impeachment against i no resolution of censure not even a resolution point out any abuse in any of the executive departments of the government to be correct by legislation this be the high commendation which could be bestow on the head of these departments the sovereign people of the states will however i trust save my successor whoever they may be from any such ordeal they be frank bold and honest they det delator and informer i therefore in the name and as the representative of this great people and stand upon the rampart of the constitution which they have ordain and establish do solemnly protest against these unprecedented and unconstitutional proceeding
 there be still another committee raise by the house on the 6th march last on motion of mr. hoard to which i have not the slight objection the resolution create it be confine to specific charge which i have ever since be ready and willing to meet i have at all time invite and defy fair investigation upon constitutional principle i have receive no notice that this committee have ever proceed to the investigation
 why should the house of representatives desire to encroach on the other department of the government their rightful power be ample for every legitimate purpose they be the impeach body in their legislative capacity it be their most wise and wholesome prerogative to institute rigid examination into the manner in which all department of the government be conduct with a view to reform abuse to promote economy and to improve every branch of administration should they find reason to believe in the course of their examination that any grave offense have be commit by the president or any officer of the government render it proper in their judgment to resort to impeachment their course would be plain they would then transfer the question from their legislative to their accusatory jurisdiction and take care that in all the preliminary judicial proceeding preparatory to the vote of article of impeachment the accuse should enjoy the benefit of cross examine the witness and all the other safeguard with which the constitution surround every american citizen
 if in a legislative investigation it should appear that the public interest require the removal of any officer of the government no president have ever exist who after give he a fair hearing would hesitate to apply the remedy
 this i take to be the ancient and well establish practice an adherence to it will well promote the harmony and the dignity of the intercourse between the coordinate branch of the government and render we all more respectable both in the eye of our own countryman and of foreign nation

fellow citizen of the senate and house of representatives throughout the year since our last meeting the country have be eminently prosperous in all its material interest the general health have be excellent our harvest have be abundant and plenty smile throughout the laud our commerce and manufacture have be prosecute with energy and industry and have yield fair and ample return in short no nation in the tide of time have ever present a spectacle of great material prosperity than we have do until within a very recent period why be it then that discontent now so extensively prevail and the union of the states which be the source of all these blessing be threaten with destruction?the long continue and intemperate interference of the northern people with the question of slavery in the southern states have at length produce its natural effect the different section of the union be now array against each other and the time have arrive so much dread by the father of his country when hostile geographical party have be form i have long foresee and often forewarn my countryman of the now impend danger this do not proceed solely from the claim on the part of congress or the territorial legislature to exclude slavery from the territories nor from the effort of different states to defeat the execution of the fugitive slave law all or any of these evil might have be endure by the south without danger to the union as other have be in the hope that time and reflection might apply the remedy the immediate peril arise not so much from these cause as from the fact that the incessant and violent agitation of the slavery question throughout the north for the last quarter of a century have at length produce its malign influence on the slave and inspire they with vague notion of freedom hence a sense of security no long exist around the family altar this feeling of peace at home have give place to apprehension of servile insurrection many a matron throughout the south retire at night in dread of what may befall herself and child before the morning should this apprehension of domestic danger whether real or imaginary extend and intensify itself until it shall pervade the masse of the southern people then disunion will become inevitable self preservation be the first law of nature and have be implant in the heart of man by his creator for the wise purpose and no political union however fraught with blessing and benefit in all other respect can long continue if the necessary consequence be to render the home and the fireside of nearly half the party to it habitually and hopelessly insecure soon or later the bond of such a union must be sever it be my conviction that this fatal period have not yet arrive and my prayer to god be that he would preserve the constitution and the union throughout all generation but let we take warning in time and remove the cause of danger it can not be deny that for five and twenty year the agitation at the north against slavery have be incessant in 1835 pictorial handbill and inflammatory appeal be circulate extensively throughout the south of a character to excite the passion of the slave and in the language of general jackson to stimulate they to insurrection and produce all the horror of a servile war this agitation have ever since be continue by the public press by the proceeding of state and county convention and by abolition sermon and lecture the time of congress have be occupy in violent speech on this never end subject and appeal in pamphlet and other form indorse by distinguished name have be send forth from this central point and spread broadcast over the union how easy would it be for the american people to settle the slavery question forever and to restore peace and harmony to this distracted country they and they alone can do it all that be necessary to accomplish the object and all for which the slave states have ever contend be to be let alone and permit to manage their domestic institution in their own way as sovereign state they and they alone be responsible before god and the world for the slavery exist among they for this the people of the north be not more responsible and have no more fight to interfere than with similar institution in russia or in brazil upon their good sense and patriotic forbearance i confess i still greatly rely without their aid it be beyond the power of any president no matter what may be his own political proclivity to restore peace and harmony among the states wisely limited and restrain as be his power under our constitution and law he alone can accomplish but little for good or for evil on such a momentous question and this bring i to observe that the election of any one of our fellow citizen to the office of president do not of itself afford just cause for dissolve the union this be more especially true if his election have be effect by a mere plurality and not a majority of the people and have result from transient and temporary cause which may probably never again occur in order to justify a resort to revolutionary resistance the federal government must be guilty of a deliberate palpable and dangerous exercise of power not grant by the constitution the late presidential election however have be hold in strict conformity with its express provision how then can the result justify a revolution to destroy this very constitution reason justice a regard for the constitution all require that we shall wait for some overt and dangerous act on the part of the president elect before resort to such a remedy it be say however that the antecedent of the president elect have be sufficient to justify the fear of the south that he will attempt to invade their constitutional right but be such apprehension of contingent danger in the future sufficient to justify the immediate destruction of the noble system of government ever devise by mortal from the very nature of his office and its high responsibility he must necessarily be conservative the stern duty of administer the vast and complicated concern of this government afford in itself a guaranty that he will not attempt any violation of a clear constitutional right after all he be no more than the chief executive officer of the government his province be not to make but to execute the law and it be a remarkable fact in our history that notwithstanding the repeat effort of the antislavery party no single act have ever pass congress unless we may possibly except the missouri compromise impair in the slight degree the right of the south to their property in slave and it may also be observe judge from present indication that no probability exist of the passage of such an act by a majority of both houses either in the present or the next congress surely under these circumstance we ought to be restrain from present action by the precept of he who spake as man never speak that sufficient unto the day be the evil thereof the day of evil may never come unless we shall rashly bring it upon ourselves it be allege as one cause for immediate secession that the southern states be deny equal right with the other states in the common territories but by what authority be these deny not by congress which have never pass and i believe never will pass any act to exclude slavery from these territories and certainly not by the supreme court which have solemnly decide that slave be property and like all other property their owner have a right to take they into the common territories and hold they there under the protection of the constitution so far then as congress be concern the objection be not to anything they have already do but to what they may do hereafter it will surely be admit that this apprehension of future danger be no good reason for an immediate dissolution of the union it be true that the territorial legislature of kansas on the 23d february 1860 pass in great haste an act over the veto of the governor declare that slavery be and shall be forever prohibit in this territory such an act however plainly violate the right of property secure by the constitution will surely be declare void by the judiciary whenever it shall be present in a legal form only three day after my inauguration the supreme court of the united states solemnly adjudge that this power do not exist in a territorial legislature yet such have be the factious temper of the time that the correctness of this decision have be extensively impugn before the people and the question have give rise to angry political conflict throughout the country those who have appeal from this judgment of our high constitutional tribunal to popular assembly would if they could invest a territorial legislature with power to annul the sacred right of property this power congress be expressly forbid by the federal constitution to exercise every state legislature in the union be forbid by its own constitution to exercise it it can not be exercise in any state except by the people in their high sovereign capacity when frame or amend their state constitution in like manner it can only be exercise by the people of a territory represent in a convention of delegate for the purpose of frame a constitution preparatory to admission as a state into the union then and not until then be they invest with power to decide the question whether slavery shall or shall not exist within their limit this be an act of sovereign authority and not of subordinate territorial legislation be it otherwise then indeed would the equality of the states in the territories be destroy and the right of property in slave would depend not upon the guaranty of the constitution but upon the shift majority of an irresponsible territorial legislature such a doctrine from its intrinsic unsoundness can not long influence any considerable portion of our people much less can it afford a good reason for a dissolution of the union the most palpable violation of constitutional duty which have yet be commit consist in the act of different state legislature to defeat the execution of the fugitive slave law it ought to be remember however that for these act neither congress nor any president can justly be hold responsible having be pass in violation of the federal constitution they be therefore null and void all the court both state and national before whom the question have arise have from the beginning declare the fugitive slave law to be constitutional the single exception be that of a state court in wisconsin and this have not only be reverse by the proper appellate tribunal but have meet with such universal reprobation that there can be no danger from it as a precedent the validity of this law have be establish over and over again by the supreme court of the united states with perfect unanimity it be round upon an express provision of the constitution require that fugitive slave who escape from service in one state to another shall be deliver up to their master without this provision it be a well know historical fact that the constitution itself could never have be adopt by the convention in one form or other under the act of 1793 and 1850 both be substantially the same the fugitive slave law have be the law of the land from the day of washington until the present moment here then a clear case be present in which it will be the duty of the next president as it have be my own to act with vigor in execute this supreme law against the conflict enactment of state legislature should he fail in the performance of this high duty he will then have manifest a disregard of the constitution and law to the great injury of the people of nearly one half of the states of the union but be we to presume in advance that he will thus violate his duty this would be at war with every principle of justice and of christian charity let we wait for the overt act the fugitive slave law have be carry into execution in every contest case since the commencement of the present administration though often it be to be regret with great loss and inconvenience to the master and with considerable expense to the government let we trust that the state legislature will repeal their unconstitutional and obnoxious enactment unless this shall be do without unnecessary delay it be impossible for any human power to save the union the southern states stand on the basis of the constitution have right to demand this act of justice from the states of the north should it be refuse then the constitution to which all the states be party will have be willfully violate by one portion of they in a provision essential to the domestic security and happiness of the remainder in that event the injure states after having first use all peaceful and constitutional mean to obtain redress would be justify in revolutionary resistance to the government of the union i have purposely confine my remark to revolutionary resistance because it have be claim within the last few year that any state whenever this shall be its sovereign will and pleasure may secede from the union in accordance with the constitution and without any violation of the constitutional right of the other member of the confederacy that as each become party to the union by the vote of its own people assemble in convention so any one of they may retire from the union in a similar manner by the vote of such a convention in order to justify secession as a constitutional remedy it must be on the principle that the federal government be a mere voluntary association of states to be dissolve at pleasure by any one of the contracting party if this be so the confederacy be a rope of sand to be penetrate and dissolve by the first adverse wave of public opinion in any of the states in this manner our thirty three states may resolve themselves into as many petty jarring and hostile republic each one retire from the union without responsibility whenever any sudden excitement might impel they to such a course by this process a union might be entirely break into fragment in a few week which cost our forefather many year of toil privation and blood to establish such a principle be wholly inconsistent with the history as well as the character of the federal constitution after it be frame with the great deliberation and care it be submit to convention of the people of the several states for ratification its provision be discuss at length in these body compose of the first man of the country its opponent contend that it confer power upon the federal government dangerous to the right of the states whilst its advocate maintain that under a fair construction of the instrument there be no foundation for such apprehension in that mighty struggle between the first intellect of this or any other country it never occur to any individual either among its opponent or advocate to assert or even to intimate that their effort be all vain labor because the moment that any state feel herself aggrieve she might secede from the union what a crush argument would this have prove against those who dread that the right of the states would be endanger by the constitution the truth be that it be not until many year after the origin of the federal government that such a proposition be first advanced it be then meet and refute by the conclusive argument of general jackson who in his message of the 16th of january 1833 transmit the nullify ordinance of south carolina to congress employ the following language the right of the people of a single state to absolve themselves at will and without the consent of the other states from their most solemn obligation and hazard the liberty and happiness of the million compose this union can not be acknowledge such authority be believe to be utterly repugnant both to the principle upon which the general government be constitute and to the object which it be expressly form to attain it be not pretend that any clause in the constitution give countenance to such a theory it be altogether round upon inference not from any language contain in the instrument itself but from the sovereign character of the several states by which it be ratify but be it beyond the power of a state like an individual to yield a portion of its sovereign right to secure the remainder in the language of mr. madison who have be call the father of the constitution it be form by the states that be by the people in each of the states act in their high sovereign capacity and form consequently by the same authority which form the state constitution nor be the government of the united states create by the constitution less a government in the strict sense of the term within the sphere of its power than the government create by the constitution of the states be within their several sphere it be like they organize into legislative executive and judiciary department it operate like they directly on person and thing and like they it have at command a physical force for execute the power commit to it it be intend to be perpetual and not to be annul at the pleasure of any one of the contracting party the old articles of confederation be entitle articles of confederation and perpetual union between the states and by the thirteenth article it be expressly declare that the article of this confederation shall be inviolably observe by every state and the union shall be perpetual the preamble to the constitution of the united states have express reference to the articles of confederation recite that it be establish in order to form a more perfect union and yet it be contend that this more perfect union do not include the essential attribute of perpetuity but that the union be design to be perpetual appear conclusively from the nature and extent of the power confer by the constitution on the federal government these power embrace the very high attribute of national sovereignty they place both the sword and the purse under its control congress have power to make war and to make peace to raise and support army and navy and to conclude treaty with foreign government it be invest with the power to coin money and to regulate the value thereof and to regulate commerce with foreign nation and among the several states it be not necessary to enumerate the other high power which have be confer upon the federal government in order to carry the enumerate power into effect congress possess the exclusive right to lay and collect duty on import and in common with the states to lay and collect all other taxis but the constitution have not only confer these high power upon congress but it have adopt effectual mean to restrain the states from interfere with their exercise for that purpose it have in strong prohibitory language expressly declare that no state shall enter into any treaty alliance or confederation grant letter of marque and reprisal coin money emit bill of credit make anything but gold and silver coin a tender in payment of debt pass any bill of attainder ex post facto law or law impair the obligation of contract moreover no state shall without the consent of the congress lie any impost or duty on import or export except what may be absolutely necessary for execute its inspection law and if they exceed this amount the excess shall belong to the united states and no state shall without the consent of congress lie any duty of tonnage keep troop or ship of war in time of peace enter into any agreement or compact with another state or with a foreign power or engage in war unless actually invade or in such imminent danger as will not admit of delay in order still far to secure the uninterrupted exercise of these high power against state interposition it be provide that this constitution and the law of the united states which shall be make in pursuance thereof and all treaty make or which shall be make under the authority of the united states shall be the supreme law of the land and the judge in every state shall be bind thereby anything in the constitution or law of any state to the contrary notwithstanding the solemn sanction of religion have be superadde to the obligation of official duty and all senators and representatives of the united states all member of state legislature and all executive and judicial officer both of the united states and of the several states shall be bind by oath or affirmation to support this constitution "in order to carry into effect these power the constitution have establish a perfect government in all its form legislative executive and judicial and this government to the extent of its power act directly upon the individual citizen of every state and execute its own decree by the agency of its own officer in this respect it differ entirely from the government under the old confederation which be confine to make requisition on the states in their sovereign character this leave it in the discretion of each whether to obey or to refuse and they often decline to comply with such requisition it thus become necessary for the purpose of remove this barrier and in order to form a more perfect union to establish a government which could act directly upon the people and execute its own law without the intermediate agency of the states this have be accomplish by the constitution of the united states in short the government create by the constitution and derive its authority from the sovereign people of each of the several states have precisely the same right to exercise its power over the people of all these states in in the enumerate case that each one of they possess over subject not delegate to the united states but reserve to the states respectively or to the people "to the extent of the delegate power the constitution of the united states be as much a part of the constitution of each state and be as bind upon its people as though it have be textually insert therein this government therefore be a great and powerful government invest with all the attribute of sovereignty over the special subject to which its authority extend its framer never intend to implant in its bosom the seed of its own destruction nor be they at its creation guilty of the absurdity of provide for its own dissolution it be not intend by its framer to be the baseless fabric of a vision which at the touch of the enchanter would vanish into thin air but a substantial and mighty fabric capable of resist the slow decay of time and of defy the storm of age indeed well may the jealous patriot of that day have indulge fear that a government of such high power might violate the reserved right of the states and wisely do they adopt the rule of a strict construction of these power to prevent the danger but they do not fear nor have they any reason to imagine that the constitution would ever be so interpret as to enable any state by her own act and without the consent of her sister states to discharge her people from all or any of their federal obligation it may be ask then be the people of the states without redress against the tyranny and oppression of the federal government by no mean the right of resistance on the part of the govern against the oppression of their government can not be deny it exist independently of all constitution and have be exercise at all period of the world 's history under it old government have be destroy and new one have take their place it be embody in strong and express language in our own declaration of independence but the distinction must ever be observe that this be revolution against an establish government and not a voluntary secession from it by virtue of an inherent constitutional right in short let we look the danger fairly in the face secession be neither more nor less than revolution it may or it may not be a justifiable revolution but still it be revolution what in the meantime be the responsibility and true position of the executive he be bind by solemn oath before god and the country to take care that the law be faithfully execute and from this obligation he can not be absolve by any human power but what if the performance of this duty in whole or in part have be render impracticable by event over which he could have exercise no control such at the present moment be the case throughout the state of south carolina so far as the law of the united states to secure the administration of justice by mean of the federal judiciary be concern all the federal officer within its limit through whose agency alone these law can be carry into execution have already resign we no long have a district judge a district attorney or a marshal in south carolina in fact the whole machinery of the federal government necessary for the distribution of remedial justice among the people have be demolish and it would be difficult if not impossible to replace it the only act of congress on the statute book bear upon this subject be those of february 28 1795 and march 3 1807 these authorize the president after he shall have ascertain that the marshal with his posse comitatus be unable to execute civil or criminal process in any particular case to call forth the militia and employ the army and navy to aid he in perform this service having first by proclamation command the insurgent to disperse and retire peaceably to their respective abode within a limited time this duty can not by possibility be perform in a state where no judicial authority exist to issue process and where there be no marshal to execute it and where even if there be such an officer the entire population would constitute one solid combination to resist he the bare enumeration of these provision prove how inadequate they be without further legislation to overcome a united opposition in a single state not to speak of other state who may place themselves in a similar attitude congress alone have power to decide whether the present law can or can not be amend so as to carry out more effectually the object of the constitution the same insuperable obstacle do not lie in the way of execute the law for the collection of the custom the revenue still continue to be collect as heretofore at the custom house in charleston and should the collector unfortunately resign a successor may be appoint to perform this duty then in regard to the property of the united states in south carolina this have be purchase for a fair equivalent by the consent of the legislature of the state for the erection of fort magazine arsenal etc and over these the authority to exercise exclusive legislation have be expressly grant by the constitution to congress it be not believe that any attempt will be make to expel the united states from this property by force but if in this i should prove to be mistake the officer in command of the fort have receive order to act strictly on the defensive in such a contingency the responsibility for consequence would rightfully rest upon the head of the assailant apart from the execution of the law so far as this may be practicable the executive have no authority to decide what shall be the relation between the federal government and south carolina he have be invest with no such discretion he possess no power to change the relation heretofore exist between they much less to acknowledge the independence of that state this would be to invest a mere executive officer with the power of recognize the dissolution of the confederacy among our thirty three sovereign state it bear no resemblance to the recognition of a foreign de facto government involve no such responsibility any attempt to do this would on his part be a naked act of usurpation it be therefore my duty to submit to congress the whole question in all its beating the course of event be so rapidly hasten forward that the emergency may soon arise when you may be call upon to decide the momentous question whether you possess the power by force of arm to compel a state to remain in the union i should feel myself recreant to my duty be i not to express an opinion on this important subject the question fairly state be have the constitution delegate to congress the power to coerce a state into submission which be attempt to withdraw or have actually withdraw from the confederacy if answer in the affirmative it must be on the principle that the power have be confer upon congress to declare and to make war against a state after much serious reflection i have arrive at the conclusion that no such power have be delegate to congress or to any other department of the federal government it be manif upon an inspection of the constitution that this be not among the specific and enumerate power grant to congress and it be equally apparent that its exercise be not necessary and proper for carry into execution any one of these power so far from this power having be delegate to congress it be expressly refuse by the convention which frame the constitution it appear from the proceeding of that body that on the 31st may 1787 the clause authorize an exertion of the force of the whole against a delinquent state come up for consideration mr. madison oppose it in a brief but powerful speech from which i shall extract but a single sentence he observe the use of force against a state would look more like a declaration of war than an infliction of punishment and would probably be consider by the party attack as a dissolution of all previous compact by which it might be bind upon his motion the clause be unanimously postpone and be never i believe again present soon afterwards on the 8th june 1787 when incidentally advert to the subject he say any government for the united states form on the suppose practicability of use force against the unconstitutional proceeding of the states would prove as visionary and fallacious as the government of congress evidently mean the then exist congress of the old confederation without descend to particular it may be safely assert that the power to make war against a state be at variance with the whole spirit and intent of the constitution suppose such a war should result in the conquest of a state how be we to govern it afterwards shall we hold it as a province and govern it by despotic power in the nature of thing we could not by physical force control the will of the people and compel they to elect senators and representatives to congress and to perform all the other duty depend upon their own volition and require from the free citizen of a free state as a constituent member of the confederacy but if we possess this power would it be wise to exercise it under exist circumstance the object would doubtless be to preserve the union war would not only present the most effectual mean of destroy it but would vanish all hope of its peaceable reconstruction besides in the fraternal conflict a vast amount of blood and treasure would be expend render future reconciliation between the states impossible in the meantime who can foretell what would be the suffering and privation of the people during its existence?the fact be that our union rest upon public opinion and can never be cement by the blood of its citizen shed in civil war if it can not live in the affection of the people it must one day perish congress possess many mean of preserve it by conciliation but the sword be not place in their hand to preserve it by force but may i be permit solemnly to invoke my countryman to pause and deliberate before they determine to destroy this the grand temple which have ever be dedicate to human freedom since the world begin it have be consecrate by the blood of our father by the glory of the past and by the hope of the future the union have already make we the most prosperous and ere long will if preserve render we the most powerful nation on the face of the earth in every foreign region of the globe the title of american citizen be hold in the high respect and when pronounce in a foreign land it cause the heart of our countryman to swell with honest pride surely when we reach the brink of the yawning abyss we shall recoil with horror from the last fatal plunge by such a dread catastrophe the hope of the friend of freedom throughout the world would be destroy and a long night of leaden despotism would enshroud the nation our example for more than eighty year would not only be lose but it would be quote as a conclusive proof that man be unfit for self government it be not every wrong nay it be not every grievous wrong which can justify a resort to such a fearful alternative this ought to be the last desperate remedy of a despairing people after every other constitutional mean of conciliation have be exhaust we should reflect that under this free government there be an incessant ebb and flow in public opinion the slavery question like everything human will have its day i firmly believe that it have reach and pass the culminating point but if in the midst of the exist excitement the union shall perish the evil may then become irreparable congress can contribute much to avert it by propose and recommend to the legislature of the several states the remedy for exist evil which the constitution have itself provide for its own preservation this have be try at different critical period of our history and always with eminent success it be to be find in the fifth article provide for its own amendment under this article amendment have be propose by two third of both houses of congress and have be ratify by the legislature of three fourth of the several states and have consequently become part of the constitution to this process the country be indebted for the clause prohibit congress from pass any law respect an establishment of religion or abridge the freedom of speech or of the press or of the right of petition to this we be also indebted for the bill of right which secure the people against any abuse of power by the federal government such be the apprehension justly entertain by the friend of state right at that period as to have render it extremely doubtful whether the constitution could have long survive without those amendment again the constitution be amend by the same process after the election of president jefferson by the house of representatives in february 1803 this amendment be render necessary to prevent a recurrence of the danger which have seriously threaten the existence of the government during the pendency of that election the article for its own amendment be intend to secure the amicable adjustment of conflict constitutional question like the present which might arise between the government of the states and that of the united states this appear from contemporaneous history in this connection i shall merely call attention to a few sentence in mr. madison 's justly celebrate report in 1799 to the legislature of virginia in this he ably and conclusively defend the resolution of the precede legislature against the stricture of several other state legislature these be mainly round upon the protest of the virginia legislature against the alien and sedition act as palpable and alarming infraction of the constitution in point out the peaceful and constitutional remedy and he refer to none other to which the states be authorize to resort on such occasion he conclude by say that the legislature of the states might have make a direct representation to congress with a view to obtain a rescinding of the two offensive act or they might have represent to their respective senators in congress their wish that two third thereof would propose an explanatory amendment to the constitution or two third of themselves if such have be their option might by an application to congress have obtain a convention for the same object this be the very course which i earnestly recommend in order to obtain an explanatory amendment of the constitution on the subject of slavery this might originate with congress or the state legislature as may be deem most advisable to attain the object the explanatory amendment might be confine to the final settlement of the true construction of the constitution on three special points:1 an express recognition of the right of property in slave in the states where it now exist or may hereafter exist.2 the duty of protect this right in all the common territories throughout their territorial existence and until they shall be admit as states into the union with or without slavery as their constitution may prescribe.3 a like recognition of the right of the master to have his slave who have escape from one state to another restore and deliver up to he and of the validity of the fugitive slave law enact for this purpose together with a declaration that all state law impair or defeat this right be violation of the constitution and be consequently null and void it may be object that this construction of the constitution have already be settle by the supreme court of the united states and what more ought to be require the answer be that a very large proportion of the people of the united states still contest the correctness of this decision and never will cease from agitation and admit its bind force until clearly establish by the people of the several states in their sovereign character such an explanatory amendment would it be believe forever terminate the exist dissension and restore peace and harmony among the states it ought not to be doubt that such an appeal to the arbitrament establish by the constitution itself would be receive with favor by all the states of the confederacy in any event it ought to be try in a spirit of conciliation before any of these state shall separate themselves from the union when i enter upon the duty of the presidential office the aspect neither of our foreign nor domestic affair be at all satisfactory we be involve in dangerous complication with several nation and two of our territories be in a state of revolution against the government a restoration of the african slave trade have numerous and powerful advocate unlawful military expedition be countenance by many of our citizen and be suffer in defiance of the effort of the government to escape from our shore for the purpose of unexampled severity and of ruinous consequence to all the great interest of the country when we take a retrospect of what be then our condition and contrast this with its material prosperity at the intercourse with each other with france our ancient and powerful ally our relation continue to be of the most friendly character a decision have recently be make by a french judicial tribunal with the the united states have change his allegiance and have lose his native character he can not therefore be compel to serve in the french army in case he should return to his native country these
