the academy which be impair by reason of the large amount of time necessarily expend in give new cadet a thorough knowledge of the more elementary branch of learning which they should acquire before enter the academy also an appropriation for philosophical apparatus and an increase in the number and pay of the military academy band the attention of congress will be call during its present session to various enterprise for the more certain and cheap transportation of the constantly increase surplus of western and southern product to the atlantic seaboard the subject be one that will force itself upon the legislative branch of the government soon or later and i suggest therefore that immediate step be take to gain all available information to insure equable and just legislation one route to connect the mississippi valley with the atlantic at charleston s.c. and savannah ga. by water by the way of the ohio and tennessee river and canal and slack water navigation to the savannah and ocmulgee river have be survey and report make by an accomplished engineer officer of the army second and third new route will be propose for the consideration of congress namely by an extension of the kanawha and james river canal to the ohio and by extension of the chesapeake and ohio canal i be not prepared to recommend government aid to these or other enterprise until it be clearly show that they be not only of national interest but that when complete they will be of a value commensurate with their cost that production increase more rapidly than the mean of transportation in our country have be demonstrate by past experience that the unprecedented growth in population and product of the whole country will require additional facility and cheap one for the more bulky article of commerce to reach tide water and a market will be demand in the near future be equally demonstrable i would therefore suggest either a committee or a commission to be authorize to consider this whole fellow citizens

 under providence i have be call a second time to act as executive over this great nation it have be my endeavor in the past to maintain all the law and so far as lie in my power to act for the good interest of the whole people my good effort will be give in the same direction in the future aid i trust by my four year experience in the office

 when my first term of the office of chief executive begin the country have not recover from the effect of a great internal revolution and three of the former states of the union have not be restore to their federal relation

 it seem to i wise that no new question should be raise so long as that condition of affair exist therefore the past four year so far as i could control event have be consume in the effort to restore harmony public credit commerce and all the art of peace and progress it be my firm conviction that the civilized world be tend toward republicanism or government by the people through their choose representative and that our own great republic be destine to be the guide star to all other

 under our republic we support an army less than that of any european power of any standing and a navy less than that of either of at least five of they there could be no extension of territory on the continent which would call for an increase of this force but rather might such extension enable we to diminish it

 the theory of government change with general progress now that the telegraph be make available for communicate thought together with rapid transit by steam all part of a continent be make contiguous for all purpose of government and communication between the extreme limit of the country make easy than it be throughout the old thirteen state at the beginning of our national existence

 the effect of the late civil strife have be to free the slave and make he a citizen yet he be not possess of the civil right which citizenship should carry with it this be wrong and should be correct to this correction i stand committed so far as executive influence can avail

 social equality be not a subject to be legislate upon nor shall i ask that anything be do to advance the social status of the colored man except to give he a fair chance to develop what there be good in he give he access to the school and when he travel let he feel assured that his conduct will regulate the treatment and fare he will receive

 the states lately at war with the general government be now happily rehabilitate and no executive control be exercise in any one of they that would not be exercise in any other state under like circumstance

 in the first year of the past administration the proposition come up for the admission of santo domingo as a territory of the union it be not a question of my seeking but be a proposition from the people of santo domingo and which i entertain i believe now as i do then that it be for the good interest of this country for the people of santo domingo and all concerned that the proposition should be receive favorably it be however reject constitutionally and therefore the subject be never bring up again by i

 in future while i hold my present office the subject of acquisition of territory must have the support of the people before i will recommend any proposition look to such acquisition i say here however that i do not share in the apprehension hold by many as to the danger of government becoming weaken and destroy by reason of their extension of territory commerce education and rapid transit of thought and matter by telegraph and steam have change all this rather do i believe that our great maker be prepare the world in his own good time to become one nation speak one language and when army and navy will be no long require

 my effort in the future will be direct to the restoration of good feeling between the different section of our common country to the restoration of our currency to a fix value as compare with the world 's standard of value gold and if possible to a par with it to the construction of cheap route of transit throughout the land to the end that the product of all may find a market and leave a live remuneration to the producer to the maintenance of friendly relation with all our neighbor and with distant nation to the reestablishment of our commerce and share in the carrying trade upon the ocean to the encouragement of such manufacturing industry as can be economically pursue in this country to the end that the export of home product and industry may pay for our import the only sure method of return to and permanently maintain a specie basis to the elevation of labor and by a humane course to bring the aborigine of the country under the benign influence of education and civilization it be either this or war of extermination war of extermination engage in by people pursue commerce and all industrial pursuit be expensive even against the weak people and be demoralize and wicked our superiority of strength and advantage of civilization should make we lenient toward the indian the wrong inflict upon he should be take into account and the balance place to his credit the moral view of the question should be consider and the question ask can not the indian be make a useful and productive member of society by proper teaching and treatment if the effort be make in good faith we will stand well before the civilized nation of the earth and in our own conscience for having make it

 all these thing be not to be accomplish by one individual but they will receive my support and such recommendation to congress as will in my judgment well serve to carry they into effect i beg your support and encouragement

 it have be and be my earnest desire to correct abuse that have grownup in the civil service of the country to secure this reformation rule regulate method of appointment and promotion be establish and have be try my effort for such reformation shall be continue to the good of my judgment the spirit of the rule adopt will be maintain

 i acknowledge before this assemblage represent as it do every section of our country the obligation i be under to my countryman for the great honor they have confer on i by return i to the high office within their gift and the further obligation rest on i to render tot hem the good service within my power this i promise look forward with the great anxiety to the day when i shall be release from responsibility that at time be almost overwhelming and from which i have scarcely have a respite since the eventful firing upon fort sumter in april 1861 to the present day my service be then tender and accept under the first call for troop grow out of that event

 i do not ask for place or position and be entirely without influence or the acquaintance of person of influence but be resolve to perform my part in a struggle threaten the very existence of the nation i perform a conscientious duty without ask promotion or command and without a revengeful feeling toward any section or individual

 notwithstanding this throughout the war and from my candidacy for my present office in 1868 to the close of the last presidential campaign i have be the subject of abuse and slander scarcely ever equal in political history which to day i feel that i can afford to disregard in view of your verdict which i gratefully accept as my vindication

to the senate of the united states
 herewith i return senate bill no 617 entitle an act to fix the amount of united states note and the circulation of national bank and for other purpose without my approval
 in do so i must express my regret at not be able to give my assent to a measure which have receive the sanction of a majority of the legislator choose by the people to make law for their guidance and have studiously seek to find sufficient argument to justify such assent but unsuccessfully
 practically it be a question whether the measure under discussion would give an additional dollar to the irredeemable paper currency of the country or not and whether by require three fourth of the reserve to be retain by the bank and prohibit interest to be receive on the balance it might not prove a contraction
 but the fact can not be conceal that theoretically the bill increase the paper circulation $ 100,000,000 less only the amount of reserve restrain from circulation by the provision of the second section the measure have be support on the theory that it would give increase circulation it be a fair inference therefore that if in practice the measure should fail to create the abundance of circulation expect of it the friend of the measure particularly those out of congress would clamor for such inflation as would give the expected relief
 the theory in my belief be a departure from true principle of finance national interest national obligation to creditor congressional promise party pledge on the part of both political party and of personal view and promise make by i in every annual message send to congress and in each inaugural address
 in my annual message to congress in december 1869 the following passage appear
 among the evil grow out of the rebellion and not yet refer to be that of an irredeemable currency it be an evil which i hope will receive your most earnest attention it be a duty and one of the high duty of government to secure to the citizen a medium of exchange of fix unvarying value this imply a return to a specie basis and no substitute for it can be devise it should be commence now and reach at the early practicable moment consistent with a fair regard to the interest of the debtor class immediate resumption if practicable would not be desirable it would compel the debtor class to pay beyond their contract the premium on gold at the date of their purchase and would bring bankruptcy and ruin to thousand fluctuation however in the paper value of the measure of all value gold be detrimental to the interest of trade it make the man of business an involuntary gambler for in all sale where future payment be to be make both party speculate as to what will be the value of the currency to be pay and receive i earnestly recommend to you then such legislation as will insure a gradual return to specie payment and put an immediate stop to fluctuation in the value of currency
 i still adhere to the view then express
 as early as december 4 1865 the house of representatives pass a resolution by a vote of 144 yea to 6 nay concur in the view of the secretary of the treasury in relation to the necessity of a contraction of the currency with a view to as early a resumption of specie payment as the business interest of the country will permit and pledge cooperative action to this end as speedily as possible
 the first act pass by the forty first congress approve on the 18th day of march 1869 be as follow
 an act to strengthen the public credit
 be it enact etc that in order to remove any doubt as to the purpose of the government to discharge all just obligation to the public creditor and to settle conflicting question and interpretation of the law by virtue of which such obligation have be contract it be hereby provide and declare that the faith of the united states be solemnly pledge to the payment in coin or its equivalent of all the obligation of the united states not bear interest know as united states note and all the interest bear obligation of the united states except in case where the law authorize the issue of any such obligation have expressly provide that the same may be pay in lawful money or in other currency than gold and silver but none of the say interest bear obligation not already due shall be redeem or pay before maturity unless at such time united states note shall be convertible into coin at the option of the holder or unless at such time bond of the united states bear a low rate of interest than the bond to be redeem can be sell at par in coin and the united states also solemnly pledge its faith to make provision at the early practicable period for the redemption of the united states note in coin
 this act still remain as a continue pledge of the faith of the united states to make provision at the early practicable period for the redemption of the united states note in coin
 a declaration contain in the act of june 30 1864 create an obligation that the total amount of united states note issue or to be issue should never exceed $ 400,000,000 the amount in actual circulation be actually reduce to $ 356,000,000 at which point congress pass the act of february 4 1868 suspend the further reduction of the currency the forty four million have ever be regard as a reserve to be use only in case of emergency such as have occur on several occasion and must occur when from any cause revenue suddenly fall below expenditure and such a reserve be necessary because the fractional currency amount to fifty million be redeemable in legal tender on call
 it may be say that such a return of fractional currency for redemption be impossible but let step be take for a return to a specie basis and it will be find that silver will take the place of fractional currency as rapidly as it can be supply when the premium on gold reach a sufficiently low point with the amount of united states note to be issue permanently fix within proper limit and the treasury so strengthen as to be able to redeem they in coin on demand it will then be safe to inaugurate a system of free banking with such provision as to make compulsory redemption of the circulate note of the bank in coin or in united states note themselves redeemable and make equivalent to coin
 as a measure preparatory to free banking and for place the government in a condition to redeem its note in coin at the early practicable period the revenue of the country should be increase so as to pay current expense provide for the sink fund require by law and also a surplus to be retain in the treasury in gold
 i be not a believer in any artificial method of make paper money equal to coin when the coin be not own or hold ready to redeem the promise to pay for paper money be nothing more than promise to pay and be valuable exactly in proportion to the amount of coin that it can be convert into while coin be not use as a circulate medium or the currency of the country be not convertible into it at par it become an article of commerce as much as any other product the surplus will seek a foreign market as will any other surplus the balance of trade have nothing to do with the question duty on import be require in coin create a limited demand for gold about enough to satisfy that demand remain in the country to increase this supply i see no way open but by the government hoarding through the mean above give and possibly by require the national bank to aid
 it be claim by the advocate of the measure herewith return that there be an unequal distribution of the banking capital of the country i be disposed to give great weight to this view of the question at first but on reflection it will be remember that there still remain $ 4,000,000 of authorize bank note circulation assign to states have less than their quota not yet take in addition to this the states have less than their quota of bank circulation have the option of twenty five million more to be take from those states have more than their proportion when this be all take up or when specie payment be fully restore or be in rapid process of restoration will be the time to consider the question of more currency

by the president of the united states of america
 a proclamation
 whereas it have be satisfactorily represent to i that turbulent and disorderly person have combine together with force and arm to overthrow the state government of louisiana and to resist the law and constitute authority of say state and
 whereas it be provide in the constitution of the united states that the united states shall protect every state in this union on application of the legislature or of the executive when the legislature can not be convene against domestic violence and
 whereas it be provide in the law of the united states that in all case of insurrection in any state or of obstruction to the law thereof it shall be lawful for the president of the united states on application of the legislature of such state or of the executive when the legislature can not be convene to call forth the militia of any other state or states or to employ such part of the land and naval force as shall be judge necessary for the purpose of suppress such insurrection or cause the law to be duly execute and
 whereas the legislature of say state be not now in session and can not be convene in time to meet the present emergency and the executive of say state under section 4 of article iv of the constitution of the united states and the law pass in pursuance thereof have therefore make application to i for such part of the military force of the united states as may be necessary and adequate to protect say state and the citizen thereof against domestic violence and to enforce the due execution of the law and
 whereas it be require that whenever it may be necessary in the judgment of the president to use the military force for the purpose aforesaid he shall forthwith by proclamation command such insurgent to disperse and retire peaceably to their respective home within a limited time
 now therefore i ulysses s. grant president of the united states do hereby make proclamation and command say turbulent and disorderly person to disperse and retire peaceably to their respective abode within five day from this date and hereafter to submit themselves to the law and constitute authority of say state and i invoke the aid and cooperation of all good citizen thereof to uphold law and preserve the public peace
 in witness whereof i have hereunto set my hand and cause the seal of the united states to be affix
 do at the city of washington this 15th day of september a.d. 1874 and of the independence of the united states the ninety ninth
 u.s. grant
 by the president
 hamilton fish secretary of state

to the senate and house of representatives since the convening of congress one year ago the nation have undergo a prostration in business and industry such as have not be witness with we for many year speculation as to the cause for this prostration might be indulge in without profit because as many theory would be advance as there would be independent writer those who express their own view without borrow upon the subject without indulge in theory as to the cause of this prostration therefore i will call your attention only to the fact and to some plain question as to which it would seem there should be no disagreement during this prostration two essential element of prosperity have be most abundant labor and capital both have be largely unemployed where security have be undoubted capital have be attainable at very moderate rate where labor have be want it have be find in abundance at cheap rate compare with what of necessary and comfort of life could be purchase with the wage demand two great element of prosperity therefore have not be deny we a third might be add our soil and climate be unequale within the limit of any contiguous territory under one nationality for its variety of product to feed and clothe a people and in the amount of surplus to spare to feed less favor people therefore with these fact in view it seem to i that wise statesmanship at this session of congress would dictate legislation ignore the past direct in proper channel these great element of prosperity to any people debt debt abroad be the only element that can with always a sound currency enter into our affair to cause any continue depression in the industry and prosperity of our people a great conflict for national existence make necessary for temporary purpose the raising of large sum of money from whatever source attainable it make it necessary in the wisdom of congress and i do not doubt their wisdom in the premise regard the necessity of the time to devise a system of national currency which it prove to be impossible to keep on a par with the recognize currency of the civilized world this beget a spirit of speculation involve an extravagance and luxury not require for the happiness or prosperity of a people and involve both directly and indirectly foreign indebtedness the currency be of fluctuate value and therefore unsafe to hold for legitimate transaction require money become a subject of speculation within itself these two cause however have involve we in a foreign indebtedness contract in good faith by borrower and lender which should be pay in coin and accord to the bond agree upon when the debt be contract gold or its equivalent the good faith of the government can not be violate toward creditor without national disgrace but our commerce should be encourage american shipbuilding and carrying capacity increase foreign market seek for product of the soil and manufactory to the end that we may be able to pay these debt where a new market can be create for the sale of our product either of the soil the mine or the manufactory a new mean be discover of utilize our idle capital and labor to the advantage of the whole people but in my judgment the first step toward accomplish this object be to secure a currency of fix stable value a currency good wherever civilization reign one which if it become superabundant with one people will find a market with some other a currency which have as its basis the labor necessary to produce it which will give to it its value gold and silver be now the recognize medium of exchange the civilized world over and to this we should return with the least practicable delay in view of the pledge of the american congress when our present legal tender system be adopt and debt contract there should be no delay certainly no unnecessary delay in fix by legislation a method by which we will return to specie to the accomplishment of this end i invite your special attention i believe firmly that there can be no prosperous and permanent revival of business and industry until a policy be adopt with legislation to carry it out look to a return to a specie basis it be easy to conceive that the debtor and speculative class may think it of value to they to make so call money abundant until they can throw a portion of their burden upon other but even these i believe would be disappoint in the result if a course should be pursue which will keep in doubt the value of the legal tender medium of exchange a revival of productive industry be need by all class by none more than the holder of property of whatever sort with debt to liquidate from realization upon its sale but admit that these two class of citizen be to be benefit by expansion would it be honest to give it would not the general loss be too great to justify such relief would it not be just as honest and prudent to authorize each debtor to issue his own legal tender to the extent of his liability than to do this would it not be safe for fear of overissue by unscrupulous creditor to say that all debt obligation be obliterate in the united states and now we commence anew each possess all he have at the time free from incumbrance these proposition be too absurd to be entertain for a moment by think or honest people yet every delay in preparation for final resumption partake of this dishonesty and be only less in degree as the hope be hold out that a convenient season will at last arrive for the good work of redeem our pledge to commence it will never come in my opinion except by positive action by congress or by national disaster which will destroy for a time at least the credit of the individual and the state at large a sound currency might be reach by total bankruptcy and discredit of the integrity of the nation and of individual i believe it be in the power of congress at this session to devise such legislation as will renew confidence revive all the industry start we on a career of prosperity to last for many year and to save the credit of the nation and of the people step toward the return to a specie basis be the great requisite to this devoutly to be seek for end there be other which i may touch upon hereafter a nation deal in a currency below that of specie in value labor under two great disadvantage first have no use for the world 's acknowledge medium of exchange gold and silver these be drive out of the country because there be no need for their use second the medium of exchange in use being of a fluctuating value for after all it be only worth just what it will purchase of gold and silver metal have an intrinsic value just in proportion to the honest labor it take to produce they a large margin must be allow for profit by the manufacturer and producer it be month from the date of production to the date of realization interest upon capital must be charge and risk of fluctuation in the value of that which be to be receive in payment add hence high price act as a protection to the foreign producer who receive nothing in exchange for the product of his skill and labor except a currency good at a stable value the world over it seem to i that nothing be clear than that the great part of the burden of exist prostration for the want of a sound financial system fall upon the work man who must after all produce the wealth and the salaried man who superintend and conduct business the burden fall upon they in two way by the deprivation of employment and by the decrease purchasing power of their salary it be the duty of congress to devise the method of correct the evil which be acknowledge to exist and not mine but i will venture to suggest two or three thing which seem to i as absolutely necessary to a return to specie payment the first great requisite in a return to prosperity the legal tender clause to the law authorize the issue of currency by the national government should be repeal to take effect as to all contract enter into after a day fix in the repeal act not to apply however to payment of salary by government or for other expenditure now provide by law to be pay in currency in the interval pende between repeal and final resumption provision should be make by which the secretary of the treasury can obtain gold as it may become necessary from time to time from the date when specie redemption commence to this might and should be add a revenue sufficiently in excess of expense to insure an accumulation of gold in the treasury to sustain permanent redemption i commend this subject to your careful consideration believe that a favorable solution be attainable and if reach by this congress that the present and future generation will ever gratefully remember it as their deliverer from a thraldom of evil and disgrace with resumption free banking may be authorize with safety give the same full protection to bill holder which they have under exist law indeed i would regard free banking as essential it would give proper elasticity to the currency as more currency should be require for the transaction of legitimate business new bank would be start and in turn bank would wind up their business when it be find that there be a superabundance of currency the experience and judgment of the people can well decide just how much currency be require for the transaction of the business of the country it be unsafe to leave the settlement of this question to congress the secretary of the treasury or the executive congress should make the regulation under which bank may exist but should not make banking a monopoly by limit the amount of redeemable paper currency that shall be authorize such importance do i attach to this subject and so earnestly do i commend it to your attention that i give it prominence by introduce it
